loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun, escasada, tiene 30 años y tres hijos de 9, 7, 1 año de edad.
Elena se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos en la comunidad de Compañía y los vende en su misma Comunidad. 
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de ladrillos como: tierra, arcilla y leña.
Elena ingresó a Finca Perú por la invitación de su cuñada, le gusta porque le dan préstamos y puede ahorrar. Con sus ahorros pudo comprar algunos muebles para la comodidad de sus hijitos.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder dar una educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Kausachun communal bank.  She’s married, 30 years old and has three children whose ages are 9, 7 and 1.

Elena makes bricks in the community of Compañía that she sells in the same community.

She will use the requested loan to buy materials used to make bricks: dirt, clay and firewood.

Elena joined Finca Perú invited by a sister-in-law.  She likes it because they give her loans and she can save.  With her savings she was able to buy furniture for the comfort of her children.

Her dream is that the business grows and to be able to help provide an education for her children.

loans.use: To buy dirt, clay and firewood to make bricks.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is married to L. A. and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan, which is famous for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in Eidgah, which is a small residential area near the city.  She is a talented and supportive lady. Besides her household work, she also handles her grocery store business at her home. She has set aside a room in her house for this purpose. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. Now she has become a contributing earner for her family. Her family loves and respects her for her good nature and care. 
She has a balanced life, giving time to her family and to her business. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her grocery store business. With the loan, she will add more groceries to sell in her grocery store. The increased stock will enable her to meet the requirements of her customers and to earn maximum profits.  
She hopes that the loan investment will be prove to be a fruitful experience for her family. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Shamim”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata, es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio, es casada, 55 años, 5 hijos. Honorata tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en general que atienD. en su casa.  El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, harina, leche, huevo, etc,  para surtir su tienda.
Ingresó a Finca Perú, por la invitación D. su hija, le gusta porque en las capacitaciones que recibe le hablan mucho D. la familia, matrimonio, salud y del negocio. Con sus ahorros incrementó mas sus mercaderías en su tienda, ahora esta ahorrando para que sus hijas puedan obtener su titulo profesional D. contabilidad y odontología.
texts.en:
Honorata, 55, is a member of the Lirio (Iris) communal bank.  She’s married and has five children.  Honorata has a grocery store at home.  She is asking for the loan to invest in merchandise like: rice, sugar, noodles, oil, flour, milk, eggs, etc. to stock her store.

She joined Finca Perú invited by her daughter.  She likes it because in the training sessions they talk a lot about the family, marriage, health and business.

Her savings maD. it possible for her to increase merchandise in her store.  Now she’s saving up so that her daughters can get their professional degrees in Accounting and Dentistry.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: Valeria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas, es viuda, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos. Valeria se dedica a la venta de zapatos, antes vendía ropa, pero decidió cambiar por la venta de zapatos porque tiene más salida y es mas rentable. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías: zapatos, zapatillas para damas caballeros y niños. Valeria ingreso a Finca Perú, por la invitación de una amiga, lo que ahorró le sirvió para la educación de sus hijos, ahora está ahorrando para compararse un terreno.
texts.en:
Valeria is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” (The Seagulls) communal bank.  She’s 56 years old, a widow and has four children.  

Valeria sells shoes.  She used to sell clothes but decided to change into selling shoes because they sell more and are more profitable.

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise: shoes and slippers for women, men and children.

Valeria joined Finca Perú invited by a girl friend.  She used what she was able to save for her children’s education; now she’s saving up to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy ladies' shoes and slippers.

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es: La señora María Victoria se dedica a la actividad D. venta D. comida hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio lo cual es propio. Vive con su esposo que es jubilado ambos se ayudan en los gastos familiares, sus hijos son independientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para la preparación D. sus comidas. Se propone otorgarle el crédito por tener experiencia crediticia y buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Señora María Victoria has been selling meals for several years. Her business is located in her house, which she owns. She lives with her husband who is retired. They share household expenses. Their children are independent. She applies for a loan to buy ingredients for her dishes. The microfinance institution Caja Rural Señor D. Luren suggests granting the loan thanks to her good credit history and her personal and work references.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas, tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 15 años y 2 años de edad. Bertha tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general y también vende verduras, frutas, pollo, carne.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su tienda.
Bertha antes era ambulante vendía verduras en las calles, después se puso a vender leña en su casa ahora tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general y le va bien, ingresó a Finca Perú por la invitación de su comadre hace 3 ciclos, le gusta por los ahorros y las capacitaciones que reciben. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y poder construir su casita.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” (The Seagulls) communal bank.  She is 41 years old, married and has two children who are 15 and 2 years of age. Bertha has a store where she sells groceries in general; she also sells vegetables, fruit, chicken, meat. She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy merchandise to stock the store.

Bertha used to be a vegetable street vendor, later she sold firewood at home.  Now she has a grocery store and she does well.  She joined Finca Perú invited by her comadre (The name by which the godfather and godmother address the mother of their godson or daughter, and by which she also always addresses the godmother) three cycles ago.  She likes it because of the savings and the training sessions they receive.  

She dreams with her children becoming professionals and with building her own little house.

loans.use: For stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Enriqueta Juana

texts.es:
Enriqueta es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas, tiene 46 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo.
Enriqueta es feriante, viaja a las ferias de Andahuaylas, Seccelambras, Pampa Cangallo, entre otros pueblos.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como : ganchos, espejos, cosméticos, imperdibles.
Le gusta Finca Perú, por la accesibilidad a los créditos y los ahorros, con sus ahorros se pudo comprar un terreno.
Su sueño es poder tener una tienda distribuidora en Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” (The Seagulls) communal bank.  She’s 46 years old and a single mother of a son.

Enriqueta is a “feriante” (a vendor at open air markets).  She travels to markets in Andahuaylas, Seccelambras, Pampa Cangallo and other towns.

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise like: hooks, mirrors, cosmetics, safety pins.

She likes Finca Perú because of the accessibility of loans and savings.  She was able to buy a piece of land with her savings.  Her dream is to have a distributorship in Ayacucho.

loans.use: To buy hooks, mirrors, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Ivonne Monica

texts.es:
Ivonne e socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celetes, es conviviente, tiene 32 años y tres hijos de 13, 3 y 1 año.
Se dedica a la elaboración de llaves. Ivonne y su esposo tienen un puesto en el parque de la Magdalena, de elaboración de llaves para carro, casa, chapas de puerta, carro, caja fuertes, etc.
El préstamo que solicita, es para la compra materiales como: llaves, chapas para puertas y carros y  máquina para la fabricación de las mismas.
Ingreso a Finca por la invitación de una amiga, le gusta porque le enseñan,  practican los valores y puede ahorrar.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a member of the María Celetes communal bank.  She’s 32 years old, in a committed relationship, and has three children who are 13, 3 and 1 year of age.

She makes keys.  Ivonne and her husband have a stand in the De La Magdalena Park where they make keys for cars, houses, door locks, cars, safes, etc.

She will use the requested loan to buy materials like: keys and locks for doors and cars and a machine to make them.

She joined Finca invited by a girl friend.  She likes it because they teach her, practice values and she can save.

loans.use: To buy keys and locks for doors and cars.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena es socia del Banco Comunl Maria Celeste, es casada, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Maria Elena tiene un puesto en el Mercado de Covadonga y también viaja a las ferias de Seccelambras los días sábados y a la feria de Vinchos los días martes.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías.
Le gusta Finca porque le enseñan a trabajar, con sus ahorros pago la educación de sus hijos.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca, abrir una tienda en Lima para sus hijos, construir su casa.
texts.en:
María Elena is a member of the María Celeste communal bank.  She is 46 years old, married and has four children.  She sells clothes.  She has a stand in the Covadonga Market and also goes to the markets in Seccelambras on Saturdays and to the Vichos market on Tuesdays.

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise.

She likes Finca because they teach you how to work.  She used her savings to pay for her children’s education.

She dreams with her business growing, with opening up a store in Lima for her children and with building her house.

loans.use: To buy assorted seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es:
Kattia es socia del Banco comunal Mornita Huamanga, tiene 20 años y es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas. Kattia vende ropa para damas y atiende pedidos, que le hacen sus amigas y familiares, aprendió de este negocio de su madrina, que se dedica también a la venta de ropa. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías.
Kattia ingresó a Finca Perú, por la invitación de una amiga y está 3 ciclos le gusta por el apoyo que le dieron para comenzar a trabajar y sobre todo pudo ahorrar y con eso se compró su computadora, ahora ahorrará para obtener su titulo profesional en computación e informática. Su sueño es poder abrir una tienda de ropas propia
texts.en:
Kattia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mornita Huamanga”. She is 20 years old and single. Kattia sells women’s clothing and accepts orders from her friends and relatives. She learned this business from her godmother, who also sells clothes to earn a living. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise.

Kattia joined FINCA Peru after being invited by a friend. She has participated in three loan cycles and has enjoyed the support that was given to her so that she could begin working. Above all, she was able to accumulate some savings to purchase a computer. Now she is saving so that she can earn a degree in Computer Science and Information Systems. Her dream is to open her own clothing store.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jesús Javier

texts.es: El señor Jesús Javier S. F. se dedica a la venta de ladrillo y al transporte de carga desde hace dos años aproximadamente, el solicitante es casado tiene tres hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar viven en casa propia de material noble. Requiere del crédito para abastecerse de más ladrillos y realizarle mantenimiento a su camión. Presenta experiencia crediticia y capacidad de asumir una nueva obligación.
texts.en: Señor Jesús Javier S. F. has been selling bricks and providing transportation services for approximately two years. He is married and the father of three children in school age. They live in their own house, which is built with quality materials. He applies for a loan to stock up with bricks and have his truck serviced. He has a good credit history and is able to assume new obligations.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chicas Azucar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHICAS AZUCAR” es una grupo nuevo, iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho personas, un varón y siete mujeres.

La asociación comunal “CHICAS AZUCAR” organizó su mesa directiva como es norma;  está conformado por una presidenta, la señora Felipa , la tesorera la señora  Jhovana y la secretaria de actas la señora Justina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados: venta de muebles, venta de pollo, conductor de movilidad de servicio público, costura de mochilas, venta de comida.
En el caso de la señora Felipa, presidenta de la asociación comunal, su negocio es la venta de muebles que elabora su esposo.  Hace quince años, cuando comenzó con su primer crédito en Pro Mujer ella vendía condimentos, su primer crédito fue por Bs.200.-, a través de los años fue creciendo el negocio, y con las ganancias pudo cambiar de negocio y ahora trabaja en carpintería. El trabajo en carpintería fue idea de su esposo quién desde niño tenía ese objetivo.  

La señora Felipa, mujer trabajadora de 41 años de edad vive con sus cinco hijos y su esposo. Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación en salud, también le ha parecido buena la atención que recibió en el consultorio de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Chicas Azucar” is a new group that is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. The group consists of eight members, one man and seven women.

The “Chicas Azucar” Communal Association has organized its Board of Directors in the following manner: • Sra. Felipa was elected President. • Sra. Jhovana was elected Treasurer. • Sra. Justina was elected Secretary of Records. The members of the Communal Association engage in various businesses such as selling furniture, selling chicken, driving public service vehicles, sewing handbags, and selling food.

In the case of Sra. Felipa, the Communal Bank President, she sells furniture that her husband produces. When she joined Pro Mujer fifteen years ago, she used her first loan to sell condiments. She received 200 BOB and her business has grown over the years. With her earnings, Felipa was able to switch over to a new business and now engages in carpentry. The carpentry business was her husband’s idea since he had this goal since he was a boy.

Sra. Felipa is 41 years old and a hardworking woman who lives with her husband and five children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she enjoys the health classes. She also received good care when she visited the health clinic.

loans.use: Purchase pine wood

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
Reynaldo de 31 años de edad,  es originario de la comarca Lamai, Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es casado con 1 hija de 7 años de edad que estudia la primaria en la escuela localizada en la comunidad Lamai. Don Reynaldo es agricultor tiene mas de 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio siembra ,pues le dedica mas de ocho horas al día  de lunes a domingo, debido a su situación económica el no pudo seguir estudiando  y solo logro cursar el sexto grado de primaria. El inicio sus actividades de forma tradicional, ya que su papa tenia una plantación de hortalizas ,tales como tomate ,pepino y chiltoma .Empezó a sembrar este tipo de hortalizas a los 13 años de edad, después siguió sembrando el solo ,debido a que su padre se enfermo y no pudo seguir ayudándole. Solo se ha dedicado a siembra tradicional y hortalizas. Pero hoy en día se ha dedicado a la plantación de  tabaco, el tiene una pequeña parcela donde siembra tabaco que es donde obtiene mayor ingreso, y lo vende a comerciante que lo compran para exportarlo a Cuba. El tiene que viajar casi por dos horas desde Pueblo Nuevo hasta Estelí para poder tener  acceso a un crédito e incluso cuando se le dificulta vender su producto fuera de su comarca tiene que viajar distancias a un mas largas ,también vende frijoles que el mismo siembra a fuera de su casa.
El solicita el crédito para compra de insumos, como fertilizantes, abonos y plaguicidas para proteger el cultivo de frijol y sacarlo como un producto de calidad y le genera buenas ganancias.
Su próxima meta es de tratar de sembrar mas cultivos y de poder invertir en mayor tecnología para así poder obtener eficiencia y eficacia de sus productos y sobre todo  mejorarle el nivel de vida a su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 31 years old and native of Pueblo Nuevo in the town of Estelí in the region of Lamai. He is married and has a seven year old daughter who attends elementary school in the community of Lamai. Don Reynaldo is a farmer who has engaged in his business for fifteen years. He works more than eight hours a day, Monday through Sunday. Due to his financial situation, he was not able to continue his education and only finished school through the sixth grade.

He started his business activites in a traditional manner. His father had a vegetable farm where he grew tomatoes, cucumbers, and bell peppers. Reynaldo started planting vegetables at the age of 13. Afterwards, he continued planting alone because his father became ill and was not able to assist him. He has spent most of his career planting vegetables in a traditional manner. Today he plants tobacco. He has a small parcel of land where he grows tobacco so that he can generate more income. The products are sold to a trader who exports them to Cuba.

Reynaldo has to travel almost two hours from Pueblo Nuevo to Estelí so that he can apply for a loan whenever he has difficulty selling his products outside of the region because he must travel even longer distances. He also sells beans outside of his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as fertilizers, composts, and pesticides to protect his bean crops so that he can produce a quality product that generates good earnings. His next goal is to harvest more crops and invest in better technology so that he can gain greater efficiency and effectiveness in growing his products. Reynaldo does all he can to improve his family’s standard of living and his business.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, compost, and pesticides for his bean crop

loans.name: Vania Rosario

texts.es: La señora Vania se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de comida , se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace un año desde que retorno de argentina, tiene una niña y vive en domicilio de sus padres, solicita el crédito para la refacción de su vehículo, ya que en dicho vehículo le permite llevar la comida desde su domicilio hasta su puesto de venta y también reparte comida a los albañiles de las obras de construcción que son los que mas consumen sus platillos  de la Sra. Vania, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, su esposo le ayuda con lo que es el manejo de la movilidad y trasladar sus cosas hasta su puesto de venta, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Vania prepares and sells food. She started this business a year ago after she returned from Argentina. Vania has a daughter and lives at the home of her parents. She is requesting a loan to repair her vehicle that she uses to transport the food from her home to her vending post. In addition, Vania delivers food to the masonry workers at the construction sites since they are the customers who consume most of her dishes.

Vania is a hardworking individual. Her husband helps with maintaining the vehicle and moving things to her vending post. She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Repair the vehicle used for her business

loans.name: Lidia Ingrid

texts.es: La señora Lidia nacida el 5 de abril de 1986 en Jorochito tiene 2 hijos pequeños, ella es primera vez que esta sacando crédito de Emprender  el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y también para lo que implica el preparado de la tierra en la Elvira a 15 km de Jorochito en el lote de su madre y trabaja en tierras alquiladas o anticrético para la siembra de papa y maíz, una ves que cosecha sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de el torno, es una joven Madre con ganas de superación, desea con el tiempo comprarse sus propias tierras, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Lidia was born April 5, 1986 in Jorochito. She has two small children. This is the first time she has requested a loan from Emprender. The money will be used to buy seeds for growing potatoes. In addition, she will prepare some land in Elvira, which is 15km outside of Jorochito. The land belongs to her mother, but she also rents farmland for growing potatoes and corn. Once her products are harvested, she sells them at the market in El Torno.

Lidia is a young mother who has the drive to succeed. She eventually wants to buy her own land. Lidia is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting potatoes

loans.name: Guisela Ivania

texts.es:
Guisela madre de tres hijos, comerciante de venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace siete años, iniciando con pocos productos con dinero propio que su esposo dio, el cual trabaja como conductor.
Luego busca la alternativa para aumentar las ventas a través de financiamiento en Afodenic aumentando sus niveles de ventas y utilidades. Siendo su decimo crédito.
Invertirá en la compra de ropa escolar como: camisas, faldas, pantalones, calcetines, cuadernos, estuches geométricos, lápiz de colores entre otros. Productos que aumente su volumen de ventas, para lograr cubrir sus compromisos de pagos.
texts.en:
Guisela, the mother of three children, has been selling clothes and cosmetics for seven years. She started with a few products, thanks to own funds that she had received from her husband, who works as a driver. Later on, she had opportunity to be granted loans by the microfinance institution Afodenic. She could increase her sales and her profit.

This is her tenth loan. She will use it to buy school clothing and articles, such as shirts, skirts, trousers, socks, notebooks, geometry cases, color pencils and so on. The availability of these articles will increase her turnover and she will be able to meet her payment obligations.

loans.use: To buy school clothing and articles, such as shirts, skirts, trousers, socks, notebooks, geometry cases and color pencils, among others

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan tiene 32 años de edad , es originario de la comarca Mata Pali, Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí , es soltero, tiene un hijo, de oficio agricultor  se dedica  a la siembra de tabaco producto que es vendido y exportado hacia Cuba. Tuvo que trabajar a temprana edad para poder aportar en la alimentación de su familia razón por la cual no pudo seguir estudiando solo llego hasta sexto grado de primaria.
Juan comenzó sus actividades de siembra a los 16 años junto con su hermano, y que su papa se dedicaba de lleno a la siembra de tabaco en la comarca de Paso Hondo a 13 kilómetros de Pueblo Nuevo. Sus negocios anteriores fueron la siembra de granos básicos como frijol y maíz en época de primera y postrera. Actualmente su mayor ingreso económico lo obtiene de cultivo del tabaco y algunas hortalizas.
El solicita el crédito para poder pagar la mano de obra del cultivo de tabaco ya que dentro de esta producción el ocupa a 10 mujeres amas de casa para ayudarle procesar le tabaco hasta llevarlo a la etapa de producto terminado, y además para terminar de completar de pagar lo gastos que genera cosechar estos cultivos y sacar un mejor rendimiento en calidad que genere una buena  ganancia. Sus planes futuros son tener su propio mercado de cultivo, ser independiente económicamente, reparar su galera y tener buenas condiciones de siembra.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old and a native of Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí, in the region of Pali Mata. He is single and has one child. Juan is a farmer who grows tobacco products that are sold and exported to Cuba. He had to work at an early age in order to feed his family, which is why he only completed school through the sixth grade.

Juan began planting with his brother when he was 16 years old. His father was a tobacco farmer in the region of Paso Hondo, which is thirteen kilometers from Pueblo Nuevo. His previous businesses included growing dry goods such as beans and corn during the spring and summer seasons. Now most of his income comes from growing tobacco and a few vegetables.

Juan is requesting a loan to pay for labor designated for processing his tobacco crop. He employs ten housewives to help process the tobacco into finished products. In addition, he will pay the expenses related to harvesting his crops so that he can achieve high quality products that generate good revenues. His future plans are to have his own market for his crops, become financially independent, repair his storehouse, and have good conditions for planting.

loans.use: Pay for labor to process tobacco products & finish paying expenses related to harvesting tobacco

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es: El Joven José se dedica a trabajar en el comercio de equipos eléctricos ( equipos de sonido, dvd´s, hometeather´s, licuadoras y otros ), se dedica a esta actividad desde hace dos años, trae la mercadería desde la localidad de desaguadero y entrega la mercadería a dos cuotas, motivo por el cual solicita el crédito ya que quiere comprar mas equipos electricos ya que tiene que trabajar con dos capitales, José es soltero y vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres a quienes colabora con los gastos del hogar, sus papas se sienten orgullosos de el de que les apoye es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José is a young man who works at an electronics store selling sound equipment, DVD players, home theaters, blenders, and other items. He has been in this business for two years. The merchandise is brought in from the town of Desaguadero and sent in two shipments.

The reason for his loan request is to purchase more electronics equipment since he must make deliveries to the two capitals (Sucre and La Paz). José is single and lives at the home of his parents, who cover the household expenses. His parents are proud of him and support him since he is a hardworking and responsible young man. José is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase electronics equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room for her children and offer them more privacy

loans.name: 11 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “11 DE ENERO” es una grupo antiguo, iniciará el ciclo número diez y ocho en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada.  Está compuesta por diez mujeres.

La asociación comunal “11 DE ENERO” organizó su mesa directiva de la siguiente manera: como presidenta, la señora  Salustiana , como tesorera la señora  Nicolasa y como secretaria de actas la señora Janneth.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, tienen que ver con el comercio,los servicios y la producción.

En el caso de la señora Salustiana, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que  actualmente tiene como negocio la venta de verduras, desde hace cuatro años, comenzó esta actividad por iniciativa propia.   La señora Salustiana  compra las verduras de la “Riel”,  lugar al que llegan los camiones de las provincias y venden verduras al por mayor.  Las ventas de estas verduras por menor son realizadas por la señora Salustiana en diferentes ferias en la ciudad de El Alto, todos los días, durante la mañana y la tarde.  Cuando es necesario sus hijos le ayudan. El crédito que ha solicitado doña Salustiana será destinado para incrementar el capital de trabajo y comprar verduras. Doña Salustiana es una mujer trabajadora de 43 años de edad, se encuentra casada y es madre de seis hijos.   

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “11 de Enero” (January 11th) is a longtime group that is starting its eighteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Community Center. The group consists of ten women.

The Communal Association “11 de Enero” organized its Board of Directors in the following manner: • Sra. Salustiana was elected President. • Sra. Nicolas was elected Treasurer. • Sra. Janneth was elected Secretary of Records. The members of the Communal Association engage in various businesses in the retail, service, and manufacturing sectors.

In the case of Sra. Salustiana, the President of the Communal Association, she currently has a business selling vegetables. Four years ago, she started this business through her own initiative. Sra. Salustiana buys her vegetables from “La Riel”, a place where trucks from different provinces arrive, carrying vegetables to be sold at wholesale. Afterwards, she sells the vegetables at retail at the various fairs in the city of El Alto. She conducts her business every day, in the morning and in the afternoon. Her children help her when necessary. The loan she requested will be used to increase her operating capital so that she can buy vegetables. Doña Salustiana is a hardworking woman who is 43 years of age, married, and the mother of six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sra. Salustiana said she enjoys the training sessions.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: El señor Remberto es soltero vive en casa de su mama que es una persona de edad avanzada su padre ya falleció y el se dedica a la elaboración de artículos en cuero de manera artesanal, con el dinero del  crédito comprara materia prima para la fabricación de sus productos,   el señor se responsabiliza de su madre y se hace cargo de su manutención con los ingresos que percibe el tiene que solventar los gastos de su madre y los gastos de él, es una persona responsable que cuida de su mama ya que están solos los dos, el sr. Remberto esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Remberto is single and lives at the home of his mother since she is an elderly person and his father is already deceased. He produces handmade items out of leather.

Remberto will use the money from this loan to buy materials for making his products. He is responsible for his mother and takes charge of supporting her with the earnings he generates. Remberto covers his mother’s expenses as well as his own. He is a responsible person who takes care of his mother since it is just the two of them.

Sr. Remberto is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase leather

loans.name: Filipenses Group

texts.es:
El grupo Filipense lo conforman cuatro féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Karla Patricia de 32 años quien vende tortillas y nacatamales desde hace 14 años con el firme propósito de sacar adelante a sus tres hijos de 13, 6 y 5 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Angélica H. Girón de 18 años tiene una pequeña venta, Damaris del Carmen J.  vende helados, frescos y productos de librería hace 8 años y Sonia del Carmen Ramírez tiene una perfumería desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group “Filipenses” (Philippians) consists of four hardworking, determined, and enterprising women. One of them is Karla Patricia. She is 32 years old and sells tortillas and Nicaraguan tamales. Karla has been in this business for fourteen years, which has enabled her to support her three children (ages 13, 6, and 5). They are the reason why she works hard.

The other members are as follows: • Angélica H. Girón, age 18, has a small store. • Damaris del Carmen J. has been selling ice cream, soft drinks, and stationery products for eight years. • Sonia del Carmen Ramírez has managed a perfume shop for ten years.

loans.use: Purchase pork, corn, potatoes, bell peppers, and other items for making tortillas & Nicaraguan tamales

loans.name: 30 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El grupo 30 de Mayo lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Reyna Isabel M. M. de 29 años quien vende ropa y cosa de horno. Ella a la edad de 8 ocho años empezó vendiendo elotes, cosa de horno y yoltamal para ayudar a su madre a los 21 invirtió en ropa ya con un negocio propio.
M. trabaja arduamente para que sus hijos tengan lo que ella no tuvo una infancia y estudios y su mayor sueño es que lleguen a la Universidad. Ella invertirá el crédito en ropa y cosa de horno.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son Juana Mercedes M.  quien hace 24 años inicio vendiendo cosa de horno, elotes, yoltamal, cremas y desodorantes etc. y Elizabeth M. desde hace 5 años vende ropa y productos Avon.
texts.en:
The “30 de Mayo” group is composed of three hard working women.  One of them is Reyna Isabel M. M., 29, who sells clothes and baked goods.  She started out at the age of 8 selling corn on the cob, “cosa de horno” (an assortment of three or four typical baked pastries) and “yoltamal” (typical Nicaraguan corn and cheese tamal) to help her mother and at the age of 21 invested in clothes as a business of her own.

She works hard so that her children will have what she did not have, a childhood and an education.  Her greatest dream is that they get to the university.  She will use the loan to buy clothes and “cosa de horno.”

The other group members are Juana Mercedes M. who started selling “cosa de horno,” corn on the cob, “yoltamales,” creams, deodorants, etc. 24 years ago and Elizabeth M. who has sold clothes and Avon products for the past five years.

loans.use: For clothes.

loans.name: Brisas Del Xolotlan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Brisas del Xolotlan  lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Magela del Carmen M. M. quien tiene una venta desde hace 8 años el cual inicio con poco vendiendo chiverías y gaseosas. Actualmente ella vende varios productos en su negocio y en la compra de mercadería es que invertirá el crédito. 
Las otras integrantes son Ana Rosa M. Montes quien vende ropa desde hace tres años y Juana R. vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The “Brisas del Xolotlan” group is composed of three hard working women.  One of them is Magela del Carmen M. M. who has had a grocery store for the last 8 years.  She started out with very little selling snacks and soft drinks.  Currently she sells a variety of products in her store and she will use the loan to buy merchandise.

The other group members are Ana Rosa M. Montes who has sold clothes for the last three years and Juana R. who has sold clothes and cosmetics for the last three years.

loans.use: For basic grains.

loans.name: Buen Camino Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Buen Camino está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Fátima Aduray de 25 años quien vende de ropa más de 5 años. Ella inicio su negocio con unos préstamos que hiso el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
Ella tiene la meta de terminar su carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas y salir adelante.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son Jamileth Pavón de 40 años quien vende ropa, comida y frescos y Ana Beatriz O. Suazo tiene una panadería desde hace 18 años.
texts.en:
The “Buen Camino” (Good Path) group is made up of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman.  One of them is Fátima Aduray, 25, who has sold clothes for over five years.  She started her business with some loans she took out and has been growing little by little.  Her goal is to finish her Law degree and get ahead.

The other group members are Jamileth Pavón, 40, who sells clothes, food and fruit drinks and Ana Beatriz O. Suazo who has had a bakery for the last 18 years.

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
Manuela es una pequeña comerciante, de venta de tortillas, siendo su medio de trabajo por cinco años, iniciando con dinero propio que su esposo dio, el cual labora en servicios de seguridad.
Quien vendía tortilla era familia de mi esposo, luego ella no sigue por inconvenientes, en donde comienza a palmear con poco dinero, y lograr mantener la clientela lo que ha venido aumentando de producción con préstamos que Afodenic ha dado en cuatro ciclos, en donde aumentado el nivel de ventas, ha hecho pequeñas mejora  a su vivienda.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento hará un bajarete en frente logrando amortiguar la colar y donde podrá estar en mejores condiciones de trabajo, comprara materiales de construcción como: laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera, clavos, entre otros materiales para hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Manuela's business is selling tortillas.  She has been in this line of work for five years.  She started out with her own money that she got from her husband who works as a security guard.

"It was a member of my husband's family who used to sell tortillas but then she had problems and couldn't continue".  Manuela began hand making her tortillas with little money but she managed to keep her customers and increase her production with loans that she received from Afodenic over the course of four loan cycles.  Her sales levels have increased and she has made some small improvements to her home.

Manuela will use this loan to build a porch out the front of her home to take the edge off the heat and so that she can have better working conditions.  She will buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets, wooden boards, nails and other materials she needs to carry out the work.

loans.use: To buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets, wooden boards, nails and other materials

loans.name: Luz De Cristo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz de Cristo lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ariana Liseth Saenz de 32 años quien comercializa productos variados entre esos calzado, ropa, perfumes y bisutería. Ella comenzó con este negocio hace cuatro años cuando enfrentaba una crisis económica la cual vio solventada vendiendo algunos productos.
Ella sueña en convertirse en una gran comerciante que venda por mayor e invertirá el crédito en la compra  de mercadería para surtir su negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Valentina O. de 46 años vende perfumes, zapatos y ropa desde hace 15 años cuando quedo viuda y tuvo que ver cómo sacar adelante a su familia y Karla M. vende ropa, zapatos y perfumes.
texts.en:
The “Luz de Cristo” (Christ’s Light) is composed of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising women.  One of them is Ariana Liseth Sáenz, 32, who sells a variety of merchandise like shoes, clothes, perfumes and costume jewelry.  She started the business four years ago when she was facing an economic crisis which was overcome by selling a few products. She dreams with becoming a great wholesale merchant and will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her business.

The other group members are María Valentina O., 46, who has sold perfumes, shoes and clothes for the last 15 years since she was widowed and had to support her family alone and Karla M. who sells clothes, shoes and perfumes.

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es:
La señora María Adela A. de 57 años se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 10 años. Ella inicio su negocio cuando se tuvo que enfrentar al mundo sola con cuatro hijos al principio vendió sopa los fines de semana luego aprendió hacer baho con una vecina y poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio de tal manera que de lunes a viernes vende tajadas con queso, tajas con carne y pollo.
A. tiene la meta de tener una fritanga completa  con una estufa grande.
Ella invertirá el crédito en el estudio de su hijo menor de 20 años quien estudia Ingles y unos medicamentos que necesita.
texts.en: María Adela A., 57 years old, has been selling food for 10 years.  She started her business when she had to face to world alone with four children.  At first she sold soup on the weekends, then she learned to make baho (a traditional Nicaraguan dish made of meat, green plantains and yuca cooked in banana leaves) with a neighbor.  She gradually grew the business so that from Monday through Friday she sells fried plantain slices with cheese, and plantains with beef and chicken. María has the goal of having a restaurant complete with a large stove that serves authentic Nicaraguan food.  She will invest her loan for her child, who is under 20 years old, to study English and also for some medicines they need.

loans.use: For her child's English studies.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad lives in a small city of Pakistan, called Khanewal. Khanewal is located in Punjab province and is known for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in the area named Shanti Nagar and contains 2 rooms. She has been living there for the past 15 years with her family. 
She is 40 years old, married to R., and has a daughter who is 16 years old and stays at home. Shamshad couldn’t provide her education fees due to the poor financial conditions of her family. She is a great wife and mother. She manages her household responsibilities as a mother and wife very well. 
He husband owns a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops. He is a very hard worker and works 8-12 hours a day. 

Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers and seeds to grow crops on his land. Shamshad is hopeful that her husband will be able to increase his crop production and will earn more profits.  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamshad”.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & seeds for growing crops

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen P. de 42 años tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa y zapatos desde hace seis años ella decidió iniciar con este negocio ya que conocía es tipo de mercadería al ver trabajado en ropa nacional especializada en faldas.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 23, 19 y 10 años de los cuales el menor es el que estudia e invertirá el crédito en mercadería.
texts.en:
Mrs. María del Carmen P., 42, has had a small clothing and shoe store for the last six years.  She decided to start this business because she was familiar with this type of merchandise having worked in national clothes specializing in skirts.

She has three children who are 23, 19 and 10 years of age.  The youngest is in school.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise.

loans.use: In clothing.

loans.name: Aydelina

texts.es: La señora Aydalina M. Silva de 53 años se dedica al comercio de nacatamales, churros, tortillas, ropa desde hace 4 años. Ella desde muy jóvenes ha trabajado arduamente para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores y han crecido.
texts.en: Mrs. Aydalina M. Silva, 53, has been selling nacatamales, churros, tortillas and clothes for four years.  She has worked hard since a very young age to support her two children who are now grown up adults.

loans.use: For food.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El señor Carmelo C. es una persona trabajadora esforzada, y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de mercadería en general en especial ropa y electrodomésticos como abanicos, cocinas, radios…etc.  desde hace 5 años. El invertirá el crédito en sabanas, cubrecamas, fundas, etc. y abanicos.
C. tiene el sueño de crecer como comerciante que su negocio aumente.
texts.en: Mr. Carmelo C. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising person who has been selling general merchandise, especially clothing and home appliances like fans, stoves, ratios, etc. for the last five years.  He will invest the loan in sheets, bedspreads, pillow cases, etc. and fans.  He dreams with growing as a merchant and his business growing.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets, bed spreads, pillow cases, etc. and fans.

loans.name: Lazar's Group

texts.en:
Lazar is a hardworking lady and operates a dairy business at her home. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. For this purpose, she has a buffalo at her home. Her clients trust her for her good quality milk  They give her a good number of orders, which helps her to earn a good profit. 
She is 35 years old, married to J. B., and has 4 children.  All of the children are enrolled in a nearby school and getting their education. 
Her husband started an animal sales business 5 years ago. He buys animals at an early age, raises them, and sells to butchers for a profit. 
Lazar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner,  Asasah, to help her husband in expanding his business. With the loan, he will buy goats to sell at a good profit.  
Lazar is very confident that, after the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow further and make him more profits than before. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah.  This is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for animal sales business

loans.name: Luz Benigna

texts.es:
La señora Luz Benigna C. de 70 años se dedica desde hace más de 20 años a la venta de comida ella inicio con dos pailas haciendo un poquito de comida actualmente tiene una comideria bien establecida con el cual saco adelante a sus cuatro hijos los cuales cada uno es independiente. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en el negocio como arroz, frijoles, carne etc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Benigna C., 70, has been selling prepared food for over 20 years.  She started with just two frying pans making a little bit of food.  Presently she has a well established eatery with which she raised her four children every one of which is now independent.

She will use the loan to invest in the business buying rice, beans, meat, etc.

loans.use: For basic grains especially rice, oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Rout's Group

texts.en:
Rout has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s agriculture business. Her husband started this business 10 years ago and it has proved to be a profitable one for him. He works in the field and grows different seasonal crops. With the loan, he will purchase fertilizers and seeds, etc., to get maximum output from his business. 

Rout lives in Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family, in the area of Shanty Nagar, for the past 15 years. She is a mother of 4 sons. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. The remaining children are young and are at home.  Rout is also a very good mother and housewife. She is raising her children with great care and discipline. She couldn’t provide them an education due to financial constraints. She prays to GOD that they will get some source of income in the future. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rout”.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & seeds for agriculture business

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s agriculture business. His name is T., and he works in the field. He grows different seasonal crops in it and sells to customers at good profit.  With the loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizers, etc., to get more benefits from his land by growing better crops. He has been doing this business for the past 5 years, and Nasreen is confident that an investment will bring more profits to her husband. 
She is a mother of 2 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son has a construction supply business while the others are enrolled in school and getting their education.  Nasreen stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She prepares food for her family and takes care of them. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah.  This is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  She lives in Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Shanty Nagar for the past 20 years.

loans.use: To buy seeds & fertilizer for growing crops

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana M. is 46. She lives in Vanadzor city. Her husband lives in Russia now, and her son is a soldier who serves in Vardenis. 
For over 20 years, Svetlana has run a clothes business in a rented place. She likes her job very much.  She always serves her customers with a smile, so she has her regular customers and sells her merchandise very quickly. 

Svetlana received loans from Nor Horizon 12 times and has never delayed her repayments. Now Svetlana is asking for a 900,000 Armenian drams loan, which will allow her to buy women's spring season clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy women's spring clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For wood and glue.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf has a frozen meat and vegetables store in the village of Beit Fureik, near Nablus City. He prepares the frozen meat and vegetables by himself. He is the father of two daughters and one son, who are young school students. He has been running his store for three years. Ashraf is improving his business slowly by increasing the variety of goods he sells. 

Ashraf took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a fridge to display his goods. Ashraf wants to increase his customers and secure his children's future.

loans.use: To purchase a frozen meat and vegetables fridge

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis  vivía antes en la Sierra, el padrino de su esposa  tenía varias panaderías en Guayaquil  y le ofreció  quedarse y desde entonces viven en Guayaquil (hace 14 años aproximadamente). Su trabajo lo realiza el y su familia. Empiezan desde las 4:00pm hasta las 9:00pm. Unas de sus dificultades son los ladrones, la competencia que existe en el mercado  con respecto a la tienda, ya que en panes vende cerca de 900 diarios.

Está  casado y su esposa también lo ayuda en el negocio y tiene 3 hijos 14, 12, 16 y 2 estudian pero el mayor ya se salió del colegio pero no sigue la universidad. Con el préstamo  piensa comprar harina, huevos y manteca.  Sus metas es que su negocio prospere, y desea poner un cyber  y su hijo mayor y  que sus 2  otros  niños  sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Luis used to live in La Sierra.  His wife’s godfather had several bakeries in Guayaquil and offered him the opportunity to stay.  Since then they live in Guayaquil (about 14 years approximately).  The work is done by himself and his family.  They start at 4pm and go until 9pm.  One of the difficulties is robbers and the competition his store has in the market since he sells almost 900 pieces of bread daily.

He is married and his wife helps him in the business.  He has three children who are 14, 12 and 2 years of age.  The oldest has left high school and has not gone on to university.

He plans to use the loan to buy flour, eggs and lard.  His goals are that the business prosper and he wants to set up an internet café and that his oldest son and two other children continue in school.

loans.use: For flour, eggs, lard.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a young ambitious man from Nablus. He runs a school cafeteria in one of Nablus's schools. Mahmoud has been saving and looking for opportunities to start a bigger business. He took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a large amount of goods that are sold in grocery shops to start supplying small shops.

Mahmoud appears in the picture here in FATEN's office in Nablus.

loans.use: To purchase large amounts of goods to sell to small shops

loans.name: Francia Edith

texts.es:
Francia de 62 años, es una mujer trabajadora que desde joven ha trabajado para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia. Tiene una pequeña tienda en la pate delantera de su casa donde vende víveres. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con su negocio trabajando con ayuda de su hijo desde las 06h00am en su tienda hasta las 22h00pm. Tiene en su tienda víveres como arroz, enlatados, bebidas, azúcar etc.  Necesita comprar con el préstamo arroz, bebidas, azúcar etc. Y poder así asegurar el capital de su futuro ya que es viuda.
texts.en: Francia is 62 and very hardworking, having worked from a young age to support her family.  She runs a small store out of the front area of her home. Francia has high aspirations for the future and hopes that her son can help her manage her business, which is open throughout the day, from 6 am to 10 pm.  She sells staple foods such as rice, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. She seeks a loan in order to buy more inventory. In this way, Francia hopes to secure a stable income, as she is a widow.

loans.use: Increase inventory of staple foodstuffs

loans.name: Luis Raul

texts.es:
Luis P. de 41 años comenzó a trabajar en un negocio que tenía un tío de Confección de ropa (taller de costura). De muy joven inicio con el negocio de confecciono con la guía de su tío ya que de el aprendio a confeccionar. 

En la actualidad su trabajo lo hace con su esposa. Está casado su esposa lo ayuda  en el taller y tiene 2 hijos uno de 11 y de 8 Estudian en una escuela Fiscal cerca de la casa. Luis con el préstamo  desea comprar telas y insumos. Su sueños es comprar una maquina.
texts.en: Forty-one year-old Luis P. first worked in his uncle's sewing workshop. He started working in the sewing business at a young age, under the guidance of his uncle. This is how he learned to sew. These days, he works with his wife, who helps him in the sewing workshop. They have two children, ages 11 and 8 years old, who attend a public school near their house. Luis will use this loan to buy fabric and other materials. His dream is to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase large quantities of milk

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda runs a clothing store in the city of Nablus. She is the mother of eight children. Her husband drives a van, transporting goods for shops and factories. Raeda started her own business to help support the family. She requested a loan from FATEN to purchase winter clothes to sell and increase the store returns.

Raeda is photographed with her youngest son.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Remah

texts.en:
Remah runs a tailoring workshop. She works with her husband in the workshop and has hired employees to improve the workshop and serve more clients. Remah is the mother of two daughters and two sons and is known for her punctuality. She took out a loan from FATEN to purchase tailoring machines for the use of the new employees and to increase productivity.

Remah's husband appears in the picture here as Remah is religious and doesn't want her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a garden roller to do gardening work

loans.name: Warda

texts.en:
Warda, who is married to Abdulhakim, is the mother of four daughters and five sons. Her husband is a freight car driver. He transports goods for shops, companies, factories, etc., in the city of Tulkarem.

Warda came to FATEN and took out a loan to help her husband as he needs money to cover car maintenance, insurance and annual car licensing. The car is the only source of income for this big family. One of the sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee and helps Warda and her husband when he can.

Warda's husband appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman who doesn't want her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: For freight car maintenance and car insurance fees

loans.name: Entesar

texts.en:
Entesar's husband owns a furniture making workshop. He started producing sitting room, dining room and kitchen furniture five years ago. He wants to expand the business and start producing and selling bedroom furniture.

Entesar took out a loan to help her husband prepare the section by buying needed machines and preparing a space in the workshop to exhibit the furniture.

Entesar has two sons and one daughter. Entesar's husband appears in the photo as she refused to be photographed for religious reasons.

loans.use: To set up a section in the workshop to produce bedroom furniture

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud A. is a talented young man from Gaza City in Gaza Strip. He studied making perfumes and scents and started his own small shop. Mahmoud produces different scents and perfumes according to his customers' tastes.

Mahmoud requested a loan from FATEN to purchase basic ingredients to make more perfumes and scents to attract more clients. He is photographed in his small store.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and scents ingredients

loans.name: Fareed

texts.en:
Fareed is an advertising magazine owner. His small company designs and publishes advertisements in his commercial magazine. Fareed is trying to expand his business. He hired more employees and requested a loan from FATEN to purchase computers for them to use to manage the magazine's work.

Fareed appears in the photo in his office.

loans.use: To purchase computers for magazine employees

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan and her husband Naser raise honey bees. Hanan is a FATEN customer; she has had two previous loans and repaid them on time. Hanan and her husband want to increase the honey the bees produce. They bought more bees and requested a loan from FATEN to purchase capped brood [pupae that have been capped over in cells].

Hanan has two sons and two daughters: the oldest is 18 years old and the youngest is two years old. Hanan's husband appears in the photo as Hanan is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase capped brood [honey bees]

loans.name: Tawfeeq

texts.en: Tawfeeq is a young man who runs an ornamental fish and bird shop. Tawfeeq requested a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger number of birds and fish to sell and increase the variety in his store. He is not married and wants to secure a better future for his future family by expanding his business. Tawfeeq appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: To purchase birds and ornamental fish to sell

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Nhor K., 28, is married and lives with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for its rubber plantations. K. and her husband sell food, earning $10 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $85 US on food and $40 US on other expenses. K. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase more food to resell. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more food to resell

loans.name: Santos Pilar

texts.es: Santos Pilar Q. C., es una señora muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual reside en el departamento de San Vicente, en donde vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja en la alcaldía del lugar y así mismo vive junto a dos hijas mayores de edad, las cuales le ayudan a su madre con el negocio. Santos posee una venta de tortillas, las cuales elabora y comercializa en su casa de habitación, en donde posee muchos clientes. Así mismo todos los días por las tardes se dedica a elaborar platillos típicos, entre los cuales están, las yuca frita, pastelitos, atoles y otros más. De esta manera Santos logra brindarle ayuda económica a su esposo, lo cual le permite tanto a ella como a su familia salir adelante, razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos.
texts.en:
Santos Pilar Q. C. is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She lives in the San Vicente department along with her husband, a city employee, and their two adult daughters, who help their mother with her business. 

Santos makes and sells tortillas out of her home and has many customers. She also works every afternoon cooking classic regional dishes such as fried yucca, 'atol' (a spiced corn-based beverage), and 'pastelitos' (pastries made from puff pastry with a sweet or savory filling), among others. This work allows Santos to provide her husband with financial support so that they can build a better future for their family. This is why she has requested a loan. With these funds, she will be able to purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem S., 43, is married and lives with her child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for its rubber plantations. S. is a housewife while her husband sells grilled eggs, earning $4 US per day to help cover the family's expense. Each month, the family has to spend $45 US on food and $38 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $500 US to purchase cashew nuts to stock for sale when the price is good. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy cashew nuts to resell

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es: María Gloria M. D. V. D. 44 años D. edad,  resiD. en San Juan Opico, en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y 5 hijos, todos menores D. 13 años D. edad. María es muy responsable, por lo que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos. Día con día se dedica a la elaboración D. tortillas, así mismo elabora chocobananos, los cuales son muy típicos D. este país y que son hechos D. guineos bañados D. chocolate y congelados, esto cuenta con muy buena demanda sobre todo por ser un país con clima caliente razón por la que muchas personas los compran. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar masa, gas y cal para la elaboración y cocción D. las tortillas, y así mismo para comprar chocolate, guineos y palitos D. madera para la elaboración D. los chocobananos. D. esta manera María espera elaborar mayor cantidad D. productos y así mejorar sus ganancias las cuales sean D. mucho beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: María Gloria M. D. V. is 44 years old and lives in San Juan Opico in the Liberty department with her husband and 5 children who are all under 13 years of age. María is very responsible and has many positive recommendations from her neighbors. Day by day she makes tortillas and chocobananas which are typical in the country maD. of guinean bananas soaked in chocolate then frozen. Since the climate is hot there is a high demand for her product. María is requesting the loan to buy masa (a cron-based dough), gas, and lime to make tortillas as well as buy chocolate, guinean bananas, and wooden sticks to make cocobananas. This way she will be able to make more to sell and increase sales which will be very beneficial for her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to make tortillas and chocobananas.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Delmy Magaly

texts.es: Delmy Magaly
texts.en: Delmy Magaly

loans.use: To stock up her store with more basic products.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

Each month, the family has to spend $35 US on food and $22 US on other expenses. T. is requesting a loan of $500 US to purchase potato seeds to grow. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds to grow

Y. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more cows to raise and sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. Y. appears in the photograph with her mother and kid.

loans.name: Khy

texts.en:
Khy S., 41, is married and lives with her five young children in the Prey Veng province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband is a construction worker making about $10 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Khy S. included. 

In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase more land to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to expand her farm

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Lem K., 35, is married and lives with her four young children in the Prey Veng province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband is a soldier making $2.50 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Lem K. included. 

In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1,200 to repair her house.

loans.use: repair the house

loans.name: Beou

texts.en:
Beou S., 48, is married and lives with her three young children in the Prey Veng province. She rents out tables and chairs for ceremonies, earning an income of approximately $9 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, S. included. 

In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase speakers and microphones to rent out.

loans.use: buy speakers and microphones for rent

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai T., 38, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. T. sells fried bananas, earning an income of about $2.90 per day. Her husband went to Thailand to find a job. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $13 on the other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase potato seeds to grow for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy potato seeds to grow for sale

loans.name: Meas

Meas S., 42, is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sells fruits, earning an income of approximately $3.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about $6.60 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $120 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more construction supplies to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy supplies for her husband's construction business

loans.name: Sourng

texts.en:
Sourng S., 32, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. is a housewife while her husband is a recycler, earning an income of about $10.90 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $63 on food and $30 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more recyclable materials to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more recyclable materials to resell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa F. M. tienen la edad de 56 años, no estudio y esta casa con el señor ......... con el cual tuvo seis hijos los cuales ya estan casados, actualmente vie soo con su esposo en la comunidad de  Mata Naranjo a treinta y cinco minutos del municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Doña Tere(como la llaman en su comuidad) nos platica que hace un poco mas de diez años tubo la inquietud de trabajar para ayudar un poco a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, asi que con la ayuda de su esposo compraron un molino de maiz con el cual inicio a trabajar moliendole su nistamal(maiz) a las señoras de su comunidad, ella se leventa todos los dias a las cinco de la mañana para iniciar a moler, su molino lo tiene en su casa que se encuentra a la orilla de la carretera la granja- temazcal, tiempo despues inicio a vender tarjetas telefonicas y recargas electronicas para celulares, actualmente atiende ambos negocios pero sin descuidar su hogar.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de algunas piezas para su molino, tarjetas y recargas electronicas para su posterior venta. 

Doña Tere espera en un futuro con sus ganancias poder comprar un molino nuevo un poco mas grande para seguir trabajando.

Ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por este credito que le dara la oportunidad de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Ms. Teresa F. M. is 56 years old. She did not attend school and she is married to a gentleman with whom she has six children, all of whom are married. Now she lives just with her husband, in the community of Mata Naranjo, 35 minutes from the municipality of Tierra Blanca in Veracruz state. Ms. Tere (as she is called in her community) tells Fundación Realidad A.C. that a little over ten years ago, she felt the urge to start working to help her husband a little with their household expenses. So, with the help of her husband, she bought a corn mill that she used to start grinding nistamal (corn) for the women in her community. She gets up at five every morning to start grinding. She has her mill in her house, which is located on the edge of the La Granja-Temazcal highway. Some time later, she also started selling calling cards and electronic credits for cell phones. Now she tends to both businesses, but still does not neglect her housework. She needs this loan to purchase some parts for her mill, as well as calling cards and cell phone credits to resell. Ms. Tere hopes that in the future she will be able to use her earnings to buy a new mill a bit larger than her current one, so that she can keep working. She is very grateful to the organization for his loan, which will give her the opportunity to continue investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase some parts for her mill, as well as calling cards and cell phone credits to resell

loans.name: Keo

Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $13 on the other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more construction supplies to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more supplies for her husband's construction business

loans.name: Mourn

Mourn S., 45, is married and resides with his three children in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. S. produces wooden furniture, earning an income of approximately $6 per day. His wife is a tailor, earning an income of about $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $90 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a machine to improve his current business. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a machine to improve the business

loans.name: Senorina

texts.es:
La señora Senorina V. P. tiene la edad de 68 años, no tuo estudios y esta casada con el señor Miguel  con el cual tiene diez hijos de los cuales seis son hombres y cuatro son mujeres, ellos ya estan casados y actualmente vive solo con su esposo en la comunidad de Mata Naranjo a treinta y cinco minutos del municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Doña Senorina nos platica que hace algunos meses inicio a vender refrescos en su casa, ella tambien vende chiles rellenos los fines de semana (sabado y domingo) casa por casa en su comunidad con sus amigos y sus vecinos, ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que queria trabajar y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que en estos tiempo todo es muy caro. 

Ella necesita este credito para invertiro en la compra de refrescos, chiles, carne, tomates, cebolla, huevos, aceite y col para preparar sus chiles rellenos y posteriormente venderlos.	

Ella nos dice que espera en un futuro Dios le siga prestando salud para seguir trabajando ya que es la unica forma de salir adelante, tambien nos dijo que se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por la confianza que le otorgo al brindarle este prestamo.
texts.en:
Senorina V. P. is 68 years old.  She didn't attend school and is married to Miguel with whom she has ten children: 6 sons and 4 daughters.  All her children are now married and she currently lives only with her husband.  They live in the community of Mata Naranjo which is thirty-five minutes from the town of Tierra Blanca, in the State of Veracruz.

Senorina tells us that some months ago she started selling soft drinks from her home.  She also sells 'chiles rellenos' (stuffed mild chili peppers) on weekends (Saturdays and Sundays), door to door in her community to her friends and neighbors.  She decided to start working in her own business since she wanted to work and help her husband with their household expenses since everything is very expensive these days.

Senorina needs this loan to invest in buying soft drinks, chili peppers, meat, tomatoes, onion, eggs, oil and cabbage to prepare her 'chiles rellenos' and then sell them.  She tells us that she hopes that God keeps her healthy so that she can continue working as this is the only way she has to get ahead in life.  She also tells us that she is very grateful to Fundación Realidad for the trust that they are placing in her by offering her this loan.

loans.use: To sell soft drinks and Mexican snacks

loans.name: Nen

texts.en:
Nen V., 30, resides with his family in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. V. is a farmer and grows vegetables, earning an income of aproximately $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $30 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more vegetable seeds to improve his farming business. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more vegetable seeds to grow more vegetables

loans.name: Maria Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Claudia Q. R. tiene la edad de 27 años, estudio hasta el  tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor Victor Fabian con el cual tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres y uno es hombre  a los cuales llamo Kenia y Kevin de 9 años que asisten a la primaria ellos son gemelos y Michelle de 2 años. Doña Claudia y su familia viven en a comunidad de  Mata Naranjo a treinta y cinco minutos del municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Doña Claudia nos platica que desde hace tres años decidio iniciar su propio negocio de venta de refrescos y tacos, los tacos los vende los fines de semana(viernes, sabado y domingo) en un pequeño corredor de palma que le construyo su esposo. Ella decidio iniciar su propio negocio porque desea ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la escuela de sus pequeños. 

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de carnes, chiles, tomates, cebolla, tortillas, aceite, gas, refrescos, rabanos, col, servilletas, cebollines y limones.

Ella desea en un futuro seguir trabajando para con sus ganancias darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños y contruir un pequeño local en la parte de enfrente de su casa que da a la carretera ya que piensa que en ese espacio veran mas su negocio, sus clientes y sus ganancias aumentaran.

Ella se encuentra agradecida con la fundacion por llevar este tipo de creditos hasta su cominidad los cuales ayudan a las familias a seguir invirtiendo en sus negosios y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Claudia Q. R. is 27 years old.  She studied up to the third year of high school and is married to Victor Fabian with whom she has three children: two daughters and one son.  Her sons are called Kenia and Kevin.  They are 9 year-old twins and attend elementary school.  Her daughter Michelle is 2 years old.  Claudia and her family live in the community of Mata Naranjo which is thirty-five minutes from the town of Tierra Blanca, in the State of Veracruz. 

Claudia tells us that three years ago she decided to set up her own business selling soft drinks and tacos.  She sells her tacos on weekends (Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays) under a little palm-leaf porch that her husband built for her.  She decided to set up her own business because she wanted to help her husband cover their household expenses and their children's education.

Claudia needs this loan to invest in buying meat, chili peppers, tomatoes, onion, tortillas, oil, gas, soft drinks, radishes, cabbage, napkins, scallions and lemons.  In the future, she would like to continue working so that she can use her profits to provide her children with a better quality of life and build her own premises in the front part of her house that faces onto the street since she thinks that her business will be more visible from this space which means that her customers and profits will increase.
