Claudia is grateful to Fundación Realidad for bringing this type of loan to her community as they help families to continue investing in their businesses and to provide a better quality of life to their children.

loans.use: To sell soft drinks and tacos

loans.name: Dam

texts.en:
Dam S., 27, resides with his family in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. S. is a carpenter, earning an income of about $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $40 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Neng V., 41, resides with his family in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. V. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of approximately $7 per day. His wife sells fruits, earning an income of about $10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables for his wife to sell. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
La señora Mayra F. F. tiene la edad de 25 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor Ramon Flores con el cual tiene un hijo de tres años de nombre Edwin, doña Mayra y su familia viven en la comunidad de La Atalaya a quince minutos de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de tres años tuvo la inquietud de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar pero sin descuidar su casa ni a su hijo, entonces inicio su propio negocio de venta por catalogo de cosmeticos y perfumeria, ella vende por las tardes casa por casa en su comunidad, tambien sale a otras comunidades cercanas como MataNaranjo, colonia Echeverria y progereso, Doña Mayra primero lleva sus catalogos a sus clientes, levanta pedidos, lo encarga a sus proveedores, cuando llega el pedido lo entrega a sus clientes y recibe el pago por sus productos.	

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de Catalogos, perfumeria y cosmeticos para su posterior venta.

Doña Mayra nos platica que espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea tener mas clientes dia a dia y con sus ganancias seguir invirtiendo y en un futuro y con el apoyo de su esposo construir su casa de material ya que la que ahora tienen es de tablas y palma, tambien desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y que en un futuro pueda ayudarle para estudiar una carrera.

Ella nos dijo: "Estoy muy agradecida con la fundacion por la confianza que me da al otorgarme este prestamo, el cual me dara la oportunidad de que mi negocio cresca y darle una mejor calidad de vida a mi hijo"
texts.en:
Mayra F. F., age 25, went to school until the third year of high school.  She is married to Ramon Flores, and they have a three year old son, Edwin.  Mayra and her family live in the La Atalaya community, which is 15 minutes from Tierra Blanca in the state of Veracruz.

She tells us that a little over three years ago she was thinking about working to help her husband with the household expenses.  However, she did not want to neglect her house or her son.  So she started her own business selling cosmetics and perfumes by catalog.  She sells in the afternoons by going door to door in her community.  She also goes to nearby communities like MataNaranjo and the Echeverria and Progereso neighborhoods.

Mayra first takes her catalogs to her customers.  She takes orders and places them with her providers.  When the order comes, she delivers it to her customers and receives payment for her products.

She needs the loan to buy catalogs, perfumes, and cosmetics to later sell.

Mayra tells us that she hopes to prosper from this investment in her business.  She wants to have more customers day to day.  She will continue to invest her earnings.  In the future, with support from her husband, she hopes to build her house from material that she already has.  What she has now are planks and palm leafs.  She also wishes to give a better quality of life to her son.  In the future she wants to be able to help him study for a career.

She told us, “I am very grateful to the foundation for the trust they have shown in me by granting me this loan.  The loan will give me the opportunity to have my business grow and to give my son a better quality of life.”

loans.use: Cosmetic sales

loans.name: Chat

texts.en:
Chat K., 30, resides with her family in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. K. is a tailor, earning an income of approximately $1.60 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about $1 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $43 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new sewing machine to improve her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine to improve her business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita D. V. tiene la edad de 49 años, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria y esta casada cone le señor Rodolfo Reyna con el cual tiene cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro son mujeres y una mujer, los cuales ya estan casados y actualmente solo vive con su esposo en la comunidad de Mata Naranjo a treinta y cinco minutos del municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Doña Mago(como la llaman sus amigos y vecinos) nos platica que hace un poco mas de un año decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de tamales, chiles rellenos y ropa. Ella decidio iniciar su propio negocio para tener otra entrada de dinero y ayudar un poco a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que en estos tiempos ningun dinero alcanza.  Ella vende sus tamales y chiles rellenos los martes y algunas veces los jueves, tambien nos platica que se turna una semana vende chiles rellenos y la  siguiente vende tamales para variar y no cansar a sus clientes, tambien vende ropa la cual va a buscar los jueves a un tianguis que se pone los jueves en la una pequeña comunidad que se llama Ciudad Aleman que se encuentra a 40 minutos de su localidad, Ella vende sus productos en su comunidad con sus amigos y vecinos casa por casa.	

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de  carne, maiz, manteca, aceite, variedad de chiles, huevos, especies y ropa de dama y caballero para preparar su comida y posteriormente venderla.

Ella espera en un futuro seguir tabajando para poder arreglar un poco su casa y seguir ayudando a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Margarita D. V., age 49, has a second grade education.  She is married to Rodolfo Reyna, and they have five children.  The children, four boys and a girl, are married.  She currently lives with her husband in the Mata Naranjo community.  It is 35 minutes from the Tierra Blanca municipality in the state of Veracruz.

Mago (as her friends and neighbors call her) tells us that a little over a year ago she decided to start her own business selling tamales, “chiles rellenos” (stuffed mild chili peppers), and clothes.  She decided to start her own business in order to have another income to help her husband a little with the household expenses.  In these times money does not stretch far enough.

She sells tamales and chiles rellenos on Tuesdays and sometimes on Thursdays.  She also tells us that she alternates.  One week she sells chiles rellenos, and the following week she sells tamales.  She does this so that her customers have variety and do not get bored.

She also sells clothes, which she looks for at a street market that is set up on Thursday.  The market is in a small community called Ciudad Aleman, and it is 40 minutes for her place.  She sells her products door to door in her community to her friends and neighbors.

She needs this loan to buy meat, corn, shortening, oil, a variety of chilies, eggs, and spices to prepare food to sell.   She also needs it for clothing for women and for men. 

In the future she hopes to continue working in order to fix up her house a little and to continue helping her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy food and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy a larger shop to increase his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy tailoring materials and a sewing machine, and enlarge her shop

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak and her husband own an ornamental bird store. Malak's husband runs the store which is the family's primary source of income. Malak took out a loan from FATEN as her husband wants to increase their income and buy more birds to increase the number of customers. He also needs a larger amount of feed to feed the birds and sell to the customers.

Malak's husband appears in the photo as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase ornamental birds and more bird feed

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a young man from Palestine. He is employed by the Palestinian National Authority. Tareq inherited a house from his family. He wanted to fix the house, paint the walls, and install windows and doors. Tareq borrowed money from relatives to make the necessary improvements on the house. Since Tareq learned about FATEN, he took out a loan to repay his relatives and have only one payment per month.

Tareq is in the picture above.

loans.use: To repay relatives money he borrowed to improve his house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread, etc.

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a 42-year-old mother of three daughters and two sons who are school and college students. The oldest is 21 years old while the youngest is 6 years old. Wafa's husband drives a taxi car in the city of Gaza in Gaza Strip. He bought the car a few years ago through his friend and agreed with the owner to pay a fixed amount. He needs to pay the last $3000 and took out a loan from FATEN to be able to pay smaller amounts of money every month.

Wafa's husband, Abdul Hafeez, appears in the photo as Wafa is a conservative woman and doesn't want her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: To make the last payments on a taxi car

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine M. is 37 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city with her father and sister.
For about eight years Hermine has been engaged in a clothes trading business that she runs from a rented stall. Three times a month Hermine and her father go to Yerevan to buy merchandise for Hermine’s business. Hermine sells adult's and children’s clothes, shoes and newborn baby’s bedclothes.
She is asking for a loan of 800,000 AMD to buy spring season clothes for resale. This is Hermine’s sixth loan from Kiva partner, Nor Horizon, and she has never made a late payment on any of her loans.

loans.use: To buy spring season clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase items for her husband's general store

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en:
Goharik V. lives in Vanadzor city with her family. Her daughter and husband help Goharik in her business, which consists of souvenir and glassware trading. Goharik has been engaged in this business for 21 years. She uses the income for her family. Goharik purchases an assortment of products from Yerevan once or twice a month, and from Georgia once a month.
This is Goharik’s 13th loan from Kiva partner, Nor Horizon, and her second loan via Kiva. Goharik used her first Kiva loan to buy a large lot of glassware and souvenirs, which she sold very profitably. Now she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to increase her shop’s assortment by purchasing flower bowls, fruit bowls, etc.

loans.use: To purchase flower bowls, fruit bowls, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 47-year-old married man who lives with his wife and three children in Nablus. Mahmoud owns his own vegetable and fruit shop. He is now hoping that through this loan he will be able to increase the size of his store which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To increase the size of his store

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Since her divorce, Khalidaha has lived with her father and brothers in Samundri, a small city located in Punjab Province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her father, who has a poultry business, supplies chickens to a variety of butcher shops. She has three brothers, one who operates a wall-painting business, another who is an electrician, and the youngest brother who supplies bakery items.

Khalida spends her time at home doing her household chores, preparing food for her father, brothers and nephews and fulfilling their needs. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her brother’s painting business. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes and brushes that will allow him to fulfill customer needs and make extra profits. She is confident that his 10 years of experience in the painting business will enable him to improve the financial condition of his business.

This is Khalida’s fourth loan application; she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes and brushes for wall-painting business

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is the father of two daughters and two sons. He is an employee. He lives in his parents' house, since they passed away and left the house to him. The house is relatively small; therefore, Mustafa took out a loan from FATEN to build an additional room for the girls. The additional room will help the family have a more organized house and give privacy for the girls.

Mustafa appears in the photo in FATEN's branch in Ramallah.

loans.use: To build an additional room for the children

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran belongs to Samundri, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 40 years. She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She is very cooperative lady and always ready to help her family to overcome the difficulties of life.
 
She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. She couldn’t provide education to her younger children and both of them stay at home. Her elder son left education and started work to financially contribute to the family. He is a driver by profession. 

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband's animal sales business. He has been involved in this business for 30 years. He buys animals like goats and sheep in their early age, raises them up and then sells them to butchers for a profit. With the loan, he will buy goats to increase his sales and to earn a good profit.
 
Manzooran is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and will improve his income.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Manzooran.

loans.use: To buy goats for animal sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new laser photocopier for his shop

loans.name: Taj's Group

texts.en:
Taj is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She resides in Samundri, a small city of Punjab, known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. Her home is a small one containing two rooms. 

She has given birth to four sons. Her eldest son helps his father in his business. Her second and third sons are drivers by profession and the youngest one is studying in sixth class. 
 
Her husband’s name is M. A. and he is involved in the agriculture profession. He works in the field and grows different seasonal crops.   

Taj has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy fertilizers and seeds to get better results from his field.
  
He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Taj is hopeful that an investment will put her husband’s business into a more profitable position and improve the living standard of her family.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Taj.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Jecebel

texts.en:
Jecebel A. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 37 years old. Jecebel is married and has seven children. To make a living, Jecebel plants and harvests rice for sale. Jecebel also runs a sari-sari store where she sells various products. Jecebel works hard to provide her family's needs.

Jecebel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jecebel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jecebel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fatheya

texts.en:
Fatheya is a 62-year-old mother. Her youngest son is still living with her. Fatheya's oldest son is a freelance photographer. He does photography for parties, weddings and sometimes for newspapers. Fatheya wants to buy a new camera for her son to improve his work and produce better pictures and videotapes. She took out a loan from FATEN for this purpose. 

Fatheya is a conservative woman who didn't want her picture online; therefore, her son is in the photograph here instead.

loans.use: To purchase a camera for wedding photography

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita D. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 40 years old. Marianita is married and has six children. Her eldest child is 19 years old while the youngest is only 5. To make a living, Marianita plants and harvests rice for sale.

Marianita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Marianita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad belongs to Samundri, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 20 years.
 
She is a 52-year-old widow who has had a very difficult life after her husband's death. She worked hard and suffered a lot of difficulties in raising her children and surviving financially. Due to poor financial conditions, she couldn’t educate her children.
 
Now all three of her sons operate a construction supplies business. They have shops in the market where they deal with their customers and fulfill their needs. They sell construction supplies to different construction companies as well. Now they are all in a position to contribute to their family financially.
 
Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her eldest son, who wants to buy cement, bricks, sand, etc., to fulfill orders of his customers and to make more profits.
 
He has been operating this business for the past six years and Shamshad is hopeful that after the loan investment, her son  will be able to improve his income, which will enable Shamshad to save some money every month for his marriage.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamshad.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is a resident of Samundri, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, that's famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived in an area named 463 GB with her family in a single-room brick house for over 24 years. 

She is a 52-year-old widow who lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. Her children are young and working, so she prefers to stay at home to fulfill the household responsibilities and to take care of her family.
  
She has given birth to six children: three sons and three daughters. Her eldest son is involved in an agriculture profession and works in the fields, and her second eldest is an employee in a factory. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her eldest son in his business. With the loan she will buy fertilizers and seeds in order to get better crops from the field.
 
She started this business four years ago, and Bilqees is confident that the loan investment will be a good help for her son to earn better profits from his work.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bilqees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for agriculture business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase firewood with flour

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Waseem is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp. He is an employee and lives with his parents. Waseem wants to improve the house situation. He painted the walls and took out a loan to purchase furniture such as couches and other items the family didn't have before.

Waseem, who is in the photo, is not married and takes care of his parents and the household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is a housewife who stays at home and does household work. She is a very responsible person who does her work with a sense of responsibility and effort.
 
Her husband’s name is B. A., and he has a milk- and yogurt-selling business. He operates his shop in the market, and people like buying from him due to his good quality products and services. He also has a second business selling goats to butchers after raising them up. For this purpose, he has six goats at home. 

Fatima has given birth to three sons and three daughters. All of them attend school, except the youngest son, who is only three years old.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more milk and prepare more yogurt from it to sell.
  
She is confident that, by using his 20 years of experience in his business, he will successfully be able to improve his sales and earnings. This is Fatima’s third loan application. She has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. She lives in Samundri, which is a small city located in Punjab Province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She owns a three-room brick house there and has been living in it with her family for many years.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fatima.

loans.use: To buy milk for milk- and yogurt-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods to sell in a mobile stall

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda, 59 years old, is a married woman from the town of Bunawan. She earns a living through rice farming. She spends her day cultivating her land and keeping it free of weeds and pests. She also makes sure her rice crops are growing healthy. Florenda sells her harvest to the community. She hopes to earn more so that she can provide the increasing needs in her household.

Florenda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Florenda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve the business of her husband. He is a loader by profession and operates a donkey cart through which he offers loading services to his customers. With the loan, he will buy a new cart because his current cart has gone rough and rotten from different areas. A new cart will help him provide better loading services to his customers by being able to carry heavy loads. This will allow him to complete more orders and to earn more profits. 

He started this business 6 years ago. Allah rakhi is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her husband. She herself is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household works. She is very cooperative and is always ready to help her family to overcome difficulties of life. 

Allah rakhi resides in Samundri, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 4-room brick house with her family for the past 15 years. She lives in a combine family system with her brother-in-law and father-in-law, who are also wage earners in the family. She has given birth to 3 sons. Her eldest son is getting an education, while the others are too young to attend school. 

Allah Rakhi is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Allah rakhi.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en:
Niveen is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her parents in the city of Jenin. Niveen took tailoring courses after high school and started working from home, saving up to have her own small workshop later. Niveen and her brother, a Palestinian National employee, share taking care of the household expenses and their old parents.

Niveen and her husband want to open a small grocery store next to their house and need $2,000 to finish preparing the store. Niveen (who is photographed here) took out a loan from FATEN.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine and open a small grocery store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca lives in the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops, and then sells it to the market. Francisca said she and her husband work hard to earn more so that they could support their children's education. Francisca also does her best to keep her family happy.

Francisca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Shunaiza's Group

texts.en:
Shunaiza lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. For five years, she has lived with her family in the area of 32/2RA in a two-room brick house. She is 22 years old and a stay-at-home housewife.  Shunaiza has a three-year-old son who has not yet started school.

She is married to L. M., a painter who works on walls, houses and doors. He works on call and makes a good living after completing a job.  
Shunaiza has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy different colors of paint and paintbrushes to help him fulfill customer orders and make more profit. 

Shunaiza is hopeful that her husband’s business will become more profitable after the loan is invested in it. She is a new user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy paint and brushes for painting business

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is the mother of six children and runs a goat farm. Manal works with her older sons and daughters on the farm taking care of the goats they raise and breed for sale and selling milk. Manal wants to increase the milk quantities produced and the number of goats. She took out a loan from FATEN for this purpose. Manal's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

Manal, who is in the picture here, and her family live in Kofor Raie village near Jenin city.

loans.use: To purchase goats to raise and breed for sale

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a widow. Her husband died a few years ago leaving her alone with 4 sons and a daughter. It was a very difficult time for her, but she never gave up.  She raised her children with great effort.  Now, 3 of them work in a factory for a low income. Her eldest son also operates a loading business after his day job to supplement the income of the family.  Khursheed is satisfied that her sons are employed and financially contributing to the family. 

She is a very caring mother who stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  Khursheed makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son who wants to buy a new donkey cart.  His current cart has become rough and rotten in different areas.  Khursheed is hopeful that after the loan investment, her son’s business will grow and his income will be increased. 
  
She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will bring positive financial changes to her family’s life.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a loading business

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza wants to start her own business to support her family along with her husband. She took out a loan from FATEN to purchase 1000 laying hens to start a poultry farm on a piece of land her husband owns. Fayza's husband was a government employee and has recently retired. Fayza has two daughters and three sons. She will be able to help her husband take care of the family and fill the free time they both have now with a useful project.

Fayza appears in the photo in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase 1000 laying hens to start a poultry farm

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has resided there with her family in a 2-room brick house for past 8 years.  She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home to manage her household responsibilities. She has 2 children, who are both enrolled in a local school.  

Her husband, K. J., is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to passengers to earn income for the family. His rickshaw has grown old and its engine needs repairing.  Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his transportation business. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw. She hopes that with the fully repaired rickshaw her husband will be able to work for longer hours and provides better transport services to his passengers. 

Khalida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit  and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Rehmat's Group

texts.en:
Rehmat lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She and her family have lived in the area of Faisal Park for the past 16 years in a 2-room brick house. 

Rehmat is 41 years old and married to A. A., who has a date-selling business. He leaves his home early in the morning after putting dates on his cart.  He visits different streets and markets in the city and sells the dates. Rehmat helps him by arranging dates on the cart for him each day. 

Rehmat is a housewife who stays at home and performs her household responsibilities. She has 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her eldest son works  for a private organization,  her second son sells a breakfast food called nan chanay (chickpeas served with bread) from a cart and her eldest daughter sews for clients in the community.  Rehmat has only been able to provide an education for one child, who is 7 years old.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. With the loan, he will replace his current cart, which  has become rough and rotten in different places.  Her husband has been in this business for 16 years and Rehmat is hopeful that investing in the business will bring positive financial changes to her family life. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application.  During previous loans, she has maintained good credit and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy a new cart for a date-selling business

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a housewife in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry.  For 18 years, she and her family have lived in the Faisal Park area in a 2-room brick house. Zarina stays at home and performs her household responsibilities.  She is a good wife and mother who cares for her family.  In addition, she does sewing for neighborhood clients, a skill she learned from her mother before marriage.

Her husband’s name is T. H. and he sells timber in areas where gas is not available, and people use firewood to cook their food. 

Zarina has a son and 2 daughters. Her son is a motorbike mechanic who works at a repair shop.  Her daughters are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to assist her husband in his timber-selling business. With the loan, he will buy firewood in bulk which will help him fulfill customer demand and sell greater quantities in order to earn more profit.  She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial results for his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With her previous loan, she established good credit and never missed a meeting.  


Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book (the Asasah Passbook) is Zarina.

loans.use: To buy timber to resell

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a young woman from Deir Al Balah in the Gaza Strip. She is married and has two daughters. Wissam's husband sells ornamental birds and fish. Wissam's husband Ahmad started the store two years ago, and now that he has a good number of customers, he wants to increase his sales.

Wissam took a loan from FATEN so that Ahmad could buy more fish and birds as well as their feed and other accessories. Wissam's husband Ahmad appears in the picture here as Wissam is a conservative woman.

loans.use: Purchasing ornamental birds and fish and feed for them

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is married to Akram and they have one daughter and two sons; the oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 2 years old.

Fatima's husband is a taxi driver who drives passengers between cities in the Gaza Strip and in Dier el  Balah. Tafima took a loan from FATEN as her husband needs to perform car maintenance to keep his taxi in good shape.

Fatima's husband Akram appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Zeenat's Group

texts.en:
Zeenat lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. For 14 years, she and her family have lived in the Faisal Park area in a 2-room brick house. 

She is supportive by nature, and she shares the family's financial burden with her husband by making shoes. Zeenat receives orders from different shoe stores and fulfills them to earn a profit. Her husband, M. Y., sells fruit from his four-wheeled cart.
 
Zeenat has 11 children. Due to poor financial conditions, she hasn't been able to provide an education to her children.  Two of  her sons do private jobs; the third drives a rickshaw. Her fourth son is a tailor.  The other children stay at home and don't work.
  
Zeenat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her shoe-making business because she has a large order to fulfill. With the loan, she will buy leather, shoelaces, nails, shoe polish and other supplies to make shoes to fulfill the orders.  She has been in this business for more than 9 years.  She is hopeful that this loan will enable her to fulfill the orders on time and build a positive image with her clients by providing quality service. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loans, she maintained good credit and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy leather, shoelaces and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cooking gas cylinders to fill for sale

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is an employee in a ministry of the local government; he is the father of three sons and one daughter, Husam's daughter is a student, and Husam couldn't pay the tuition fees so he borrowed the money from FATEN as it would be easier to pay it back over the period of some months.

Husam is known for his excellent reputation and commitment, and he wants to give his daughter the chance to have a BA degree as she is a brilliant student.

Husam was photographed in FATEN's Qalqilia Office.

loans.use: Paying school tuition fees

loans.name: Emtethal

texts.en:
Emtethal is a Palestinian woman from Tulkarem town. Emtethal lives with her parents and works in a school in Tulkarem, Emtethal shares with her father the responsibility for covering household expenses.

She took a loan from FATEN to pay for needed home expenses and buy a bed for her room. Emtethal appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: pay for needed home expenses and furniture

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman lives in a refugee camp near Ramallah City. Nariman's husband runs a grocery store in the refugee camp. Since refugee camps have large populations, such businesses bring good income to families. Nariman took out a loan from FATEN as her husband wants to enrich the store by adding to the items he sells.

Nariman has five sons and three daughters. Nariman's brother appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman and refused to post her picture on the web.

loans.use: To purchase a large variety of grocery items

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma lives in Okara, Pakistan, where she owns a 3-room house that she and her family have been residing in for the past 10 years.   Asma is 30 years old, and a caring lady who stays at home and works as a housewife. She is a mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son is 2 years old and her daughter is only a year old. Both of them need her full-time attention and Asma takes care of them very well.
 
Her husband, M. A., is a driver by profession who rents a rickshaw that he drives. Through the rickshaw, he provides transport to passengers and receives his fares according to the distance of the destinations. He has been in this profession for 9 years.  

Asma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a rickshaw and start his own transportation business.  Driving a rented rickshaw is disadvantageous because it is not always available for him to drive for longer hours.  With his own rickshaw, he can set his schedule to earn maximum income. 

Asma is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loans, she has maintained good credit and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book (the Asasah Passbook) is Asma.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw to start a transportation business

loans.name: Azizan's Group

texts.en:
Azizan lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. For 14 years, she has lived there with her family in a single-room brick house. 

Azizan is 34 years old. Several years ago, her husband died suddenly, leaving her a widow. It was a very difficult time for her but she never lost hope.  She started working in people's homes to bring up her 3 daughters. 

Azizan's brother-in-law also lives with her. He is a loader by profession and loads goods onto trucks. But the income he earns is not enough, so he would like to buy a rickshaw and start a transportation business. Azizan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her brother-in-law in his business. She is hopeful that a new business will be more profitable for him and he will be able to provide a better standard of living for his family.
 
Azizan is a regular user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan, she has established good credit and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw to start a transportation business

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Rafah in Gaza Strip. He has a phone accessories store. He sells phone accessories, batteries, covers, etc. Muhammad wanted to increase his sales and offer a larger variety of accessories, so he took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the items he needs.

Muhammad is photographed in his store in the picture here.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida has lived in Okara for 20 years. Okara is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area of 49/2-L with her family in a four-room brick house. She has four children: three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son drives a rickshaw.  The others are getting their education in a local school. 

Khalida is 52 years old and married to M. S., who is a farmer. He works in the fields, growing different crops. After cultivating the crops, he sells the produce to customers.  To share the family's financial burden with her husband, Khalida sells milk to her community clients. She keeps a buffalo that she milks early each morning and customers come to her home to purchase the milk.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase fertilizer, seeds and other supplies to get the maximum output from his fields.  He has been in this business for the past five years and Khalida is very hopeful that he will be able to expand it after the loan investment. 

Khalida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan, she established good credit and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nhel

texts.en:
Nhel C., 32, resides with his family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. is a farmer, earning an income of $3 per day. His wife is employed at a factory, earning an income of $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $11 on food and $30 on other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer and rice seed to expand his farming business. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Isam

texts.en: Isam is the father of two daughters and three sons. He has an electronics shop in Rafah in Gaza Strip. He came to FATEN and took out a loan to purchase more home electronics to increase his customers. Isam is a Palestinian National Authority employee, known for his good reputation and commitment. Isam appears in the picture in his shop in Rafah.

loans.use: To purchase electronics to sell

loans.name: Vith

texts.en:
Vith P., 29, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. P. is a farmer and raises chickens, earning an income of $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend $45 on food and $85 on the other necessary expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for family use

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long S., 59, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of $3 per day. Her husband is a recycler, earning an income of $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $18 on food and $40 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more recyclable materials for her husband to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable materials to resell

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Tes B., 44, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. B. is a farmer, earning an income of $0.50 per day. Her four children are employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $2.50 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $80 on the other necessary expenses. 

B. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn M., 32, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. M. is a silk weaver, earning an income of $3.30 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $15 on food and $34 on the other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more raw silk to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to expand the business

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Orn S., 43, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. sells sugar canes and snacks, earning an income of $2.50 per day. Her husband is employed at a weaving factory, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend $15 on food and $49 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay S., 48, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Her husband grows vegetables to sell, also earning an income of 2 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 18 USD on food and 49 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a new motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her family's use.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum S., 34, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. raises pigs to sell, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Her husband sells ice-cream, earning an income of 3 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 66 USD on food and 60 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a new motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her family's use.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo L., 32, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. L. sells palm sugar, earning an income of 5 USD day. Her husband is a play instructor, earning an income of 3 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 66 USD on food and 50 USD on other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase more palm sugar to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more palm sugar to resell.

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn Y., 32, lives with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. Y. and her husband sell corn and earn a daily income of 3 USD. Each month, the family has to spend 66 USD on food and 49 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Sourn is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a trailer and to buy more corn to sell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. In the future, Sourn would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a trailer and corn to sell

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat O., 42, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. O. sells fish, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a employed at a national zoo in the province, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 60 on the other necessary expenses. O. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 30, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. and her husband are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 70 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase silk products to sell at the factory. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase silk products to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité está conformado por 15 señoras dispuestas a progresar, decidieron participar del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,  mujeres humildes y muy trabajadoras, formando asi un  equipo de trabajo donde la responsabilidad es solidaria.
Ellas son independientes en sus labores como la venta de comidas, tienen despensa, venta de frutas y verduras.
Las mismas recibiran créditos  que invertirán en compra de azúcar, carne, harina, huevo, fideo, golosina, queso, etc.
Desean un progreso personal y familiar con este préstamo otorgado por la Fundación Paraguaya.
La sra. Maria Luisa es una persona muy trabajadora, que posee desde hace varios años una despensa en su casa, para proveer de todos los alimentos a sus vecinos, pero desea variar más sus productos, por eso necesita del crédito.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of 15 women who are ready to progress.  They decided to participate in the Women Entrepreneurs Communal Bank program.  They are very humble and hard-working women.  They make up a work team with joint responsibility.

They are independent in their work such as selling food, having a grocery store, and selling fruits and vegetables.  They will use the loans they receive to buy sugar, meat, flour, eggs, noodles, sweets, and cheese, etc.

They want to make personal and familial progress with this loan that was granted by the Fundación Paraguaya.

Maria Luisa is a very hard-working person who has had a grocery store in her house for several years.  She does this to provide her neighbors with all of the food they need.  However, she wants to have a greater variety of products, which is why she needs the loan.

loans.use: To buy drinks, flour, vegetables, natural remedies, and fruit, etc.

loans.name: Chhuy

texts.en: Chhuy P., 30, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. P. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 1.6 day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 80 on the other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Chek T., 51, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. T. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 day. Her husband is a tuk-tuk driver, earning an income of USD 7 per day to help cover the family's expense. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 90 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Chourn

texts.en: Chourn L., 37, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for angkorean temples. L. is a farmer and produces traditional baskets to sell, earning an income of USD 2.5 day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 15 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase two cows to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy two cows to raise for sale.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy S. is 39 and lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. Dy and her husband sell traditional cakes and earn a daily income of 5 USD. Each month, the family has to spend 25 USD on food and 30 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Dy is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike to transport her cakes to market. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. In the future, Dy would like to repair her house.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Luk

texts.en:
Luk N. is 27 and widowed. She lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. She appears in this photograph with her mother. Luk is employed at a hotel to produce cakes and she earns a daily income of 5 USD. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 55 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Luk is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase buffaloes to help plow her rice fields. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. In the future, Luk would like to use the additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy buffaloes to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio Santo Domingo de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, la Sra. Hermelinda G., participó de una reunión informativa por la zona, y le encantó la idea de formar un comité en su cuadra con sus vecinas, las mismas se reunieron con mucho entusiasmo, en total son 17 (diez y siete) señoras,  cada una con trabajos independientes, ellas poseen las ganas y la responsabilidad que se necesitan, se ayudan mutuamente y trabajan en equipo.
La sra. Hermelinda necesita el crédito para ampliar su despensa, comprando muchos de los productos que por falta económica no puede adquirir; ella es una madre muy dedicada y desea que sus hijos tengan una vida mucho mejor que la que tuvo ella.
texts.en:
This committee was started in the Santo Domingo neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú.  Hermelinda G. took part in an informational meeting in her area and she came up with the idea of starting a committe on her block with her neighbors.  They got together with lots of enthusiasm, seventeen women in all, each with her own independent job.  They've got the desire and the responsibility they need and they all help each other and work as a team.

Hermelinda needs a loan to get more pantry items.  She needs to buy a lot of products that, for lack of means, she couldn't get before.  She's a very devoted mother and wants her children to have a much better life than she had.

loans.use: To buy meat, fish, milk, flour, sugar, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lizza

texts.es:
La Sta. Lizza R. de 26 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres.
Lizza trabaja como peluquera hace más de 3 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.007; ella creció en la peluquería con su madre, luego de ganar experiencia en dicho rubro, ella habilitó su local propio con la ayuda económica de su madre, en la actualidad tiene ubicado su negocio sobre una de las avenidas principales de la ciudad, tiene clientela formada por la calidad de sus servicios.
Ella utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías (shampoo, acondicionador, cremas, aceites, tintes, bijuoterie)
texts.en:
Lizza R., is 26, single, and lives with her parents.

She's been working as a hairdresser for more than 3 years, since about 2007.  She grew up at the hair salon with her mother, and after getting some experience, she set up her own shop with financial help from her mother.  Now she has her business situated on one of the main avenues of the city and she's gained clientele through the quality of her services.

Lizza will use this loan to buy more merchandise (shampoo, conditioner, creams, oils, hair colors, and jewelry).

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (shampoo, conditioner, creams, oils, hair colors, jewelry, etc.).

loans.name: Srok

texts.en: Srok R., 40, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for angkorean temples. R. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of 4 USD each day. Each month, the family has to spend 40 USD on food and 85 USD on other necessary expenses. R. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase fish to raise for sale and fish food. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase fish and fish food

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao T. is 34 and lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. Mao and her husband are construction workers, earning a daily income of 4 USD. Each month, the family has to spend 60 USD on food and 90 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Mao is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase construction materials to improve her current business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. In the future, Mao would like to use her additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials to improve business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok P. is 50 and lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. Sok is a farmer, earning a daily income of 1.5 USD. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and earns a daily income of 3 USD. Each month, the family has to spend 55 USD on food and 35 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Sok is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. In the future, Sok would like to use the additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
La señora Maria Angela  de 25 años de edad es costurera, es soltera y madre de una niña de 6 años de edad llamada Angela, quien actualmente está cursando el primer grado de la Educación Básica.
Culminó el Bachillerato técnico en confección industrial y empezó a trabajar como empleada en un taller de costura. Luego y con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar para su propia máquina, con el que  actualmente realiza trabajos por cuenta propia hace más de 2 años.
Actualmente posee 2 máquinas con que trabaja día a día para sacar adelante a toda su familia.
Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una nueva máquina, ya que actualmente  cuenta con un gran número de pedidos y desea ir aumentando su producción.
texts.en:
Maria Angela, 25, is a seamstress.  She's single and the mother of a 6-year-old daughter named Angela, who is currently in the first grade.  Maria completed her technical diploma in industrial sewing and started working for a sewing shop.  Afterward, and with great deal of effort, she managed to buy her own sewing machine, which she has been using to jobs on her own for more than two years.  

Maria currently has two sewing machines that she uses day after day to get her whole family ahead.  She has decided to put her trust in Fundación Paraguaya by requesting a loan to buy a new machine, since she has a large number of orders and she wants to keep expanding production.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sop Serigna Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE FALLOU est créé depuis un an et demi. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DIADIORDE

Madame Awa B. debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa petite fille. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes et de poisson frais. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages voisins et revend dans le village. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'escompter des bénéfices plus importants. 

Elle soutien son mari dans les dépenses courantes de la famille et dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants tout en agmentant son épargne
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP SERIGNE FALLOU was created one year and a half ago. It is made up of 15 women who are from the same village. They came together as neighbors and by affinity. Their main activity is small-scale retail. The group is a part of the "Banc Villageois" of DIADIORDE.

Madam Awa B., standing on the far right end of the picture, is in charge of the group. She is 49-years-old. She is married and the mother of 8 children. She also takes care of her grand-daughter. 

She runs a small business selling vegetables and fresh fish. She stocks up in the nearby villages and sells in the village. 

With her new loan, she will increase her supplies, in order to generate larger profits. She assists her husband with the family expenses and with the children's school fees, while increasing her savings.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fresh fish

loans.name: Francisca Aurora

texts.es: La señora Francisca tiene 46 años de edad, está casada con el señor Antonio Insfran, tienen 2 hijos ya mayores de edad pero que aun viven con ellos, viven en un barrio muy concurrido de la ciudad de Itá. La misma posee un taller de confecciones en su domicilio en el cual actualmente confecciona uniformes para funcionarios de una conocida entidad educativa, cuenta con el apoyo económico de su marido, quien es macatero (vendedor ambulante de ropas) hace varios años, también el apoyo de su hijo que es comerciante y su hija que es abogada y profesora de una Universidad. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas e hilos para la confección de dichas prendas ya que necesita capital, porque la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza a crédito.
texts.en:
Francisca is 46 years old and married to Antonio Insfran.  They have two grown-up children who still live with them, in a very busy neighborhood in the city of Itá.

Francisca owns a dressmaking workshop in her home where she makes uniforms for employees from a well-known educational institution.  She has financial support from her husband who has been working as a traveling salesman, selling clothes, for several years.  She also has the support of her son, who is a salesman, and her daughter who is a lawyer and university professor.

Francisca is requesting this loan to buy fabric and threads to make her clothes.  She needs capital because she sells most of her products on credit.

loans.use: To buy fabric and threads

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María G. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive por el sector del Hospital del Rió en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una belleza natural, cultural y arquitectónica la misma que es admirada por propios y extraños, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones siendo muy amables y cordiales.

Doña María tiene 48 años, es viuda y tiene 8 hijos de 32, 28, 26, 24, 22, 20, 18 y 14 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus cinco hijos siguientes quienes son mayores de edad trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar, su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que viven es de uno de sus hijos.
 
La Señora. María trabaja realizando los quehaceres domésticos de lunes a viernes, en esta actividad lleva 16 años. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  y fue invitada por su cuñada e hija quienes son socias activas del mismo.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una computadora para que su hijo se supere en sus estudios. Su meta es operarse del apéndice ya que le está dando molestias en su salud.
texts.en:
Sra. María G. is a member of the Communal Bank “Reina de la Nube” (Queen of the Cloud). She lives in the “Hospital del Rió” sector of the city of Cuenca. This city experiences cold weather, but it has natural beauty, culture, and architecture that is admired by locals and outsiders. The people are friendly, courteous, and maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña María is 48 years old, widowed, and has eight children who range in age between 14 and 32. Her oldest two children are married and live independently. The next five children are grown and work in order to help with the household finances. Her youngest child attends high school in the city. The house where she lives belongs to one her children.

Sra. María takes care of the household chores Monday through Friday. She has been doing this for 16 years. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs at home.

María is participating in her second loan cycle with the Communal Bank. She was invited by her sister-in-law and daughter since they are active members of the same group. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of a computer so that her son can succeed in his studies. Her goal is to undergo an appendectomy because her health is troubling her.

loans.use: Purchase a computer for her son to use in his studies

loans.name: Carlota Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora. Carlota B. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una belleza natural, cultural y arquitectónica la misma que es admirada por propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones siendo muy amables y cordiales.

Doña Carlota tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en colegio  y su segundo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá.
 
La Señora Carlota realiza la limpieza en casas dos veces a la semana, actividad que  tiene ya algún tiempo. Hace cuatro meses se dedica a la cría de cuyes en su casa.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes y así crecer en el negocio. Se encuentra en su octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y en todo este tiempo ha logrado tener muy buenas amigas. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Carlota B. is a member of the Communal Bank “Reina de la Nube” (Queen of the Cloud). She lives in the the city of Cuenca. This city experiences cold weather, but it has natural beauty, culture, and architecture that is admired by locals and outsiders. The people are friendly, courteous, and maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña Carlota is 33 years old, married, and has two children (ages 13 and 11). Her oldest child is in high school while her second child attends school in the city. Her husband works at a carpentry shop. She does not have her own house, so her family lives in the home of her mother.

Sra. Carlota cleans houses twice a week. She has held this job for some time. Four months ago, she began raising guinea pigs at home.

The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of more guinea pigs so that she can grow her business. Carlota is receiving her eighth loan from the Communal Bank. She has made very good friends throughout this time. Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Roque, se conformó el 29 de octubre del 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora General, Eva, quien se dedica a la venta de animales, se informó del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras acercándose a la Fundación Paraguaya. Una vez asesorada acerca del programa logró juntar a 18 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Es un grupo que se destaca por el trabajo en conjunto y solidario que realiza.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos,  se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
La sra. Eva cría gallinas, vacas y cerdos para luego venderlos a pequeños empresarios que desean aprovechar la carne de estos animales. O simplemente, vende los productos lácteos que saca de la vaca, los huevos de la gallina y la grasa del cerdo.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee named “San Roque” was formed on October 29, 2008. Eva, the current Director General, sells animals for a living. Thanks to her efforts, she learned about the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program after visiting Fundación Paraguaya. Once she was advised about the program requirements, Eva was able to gather eighteen women who enjoy working. They are in their sixth loan cycle working together in the program.

The group is known for working together and cooperating with one another. All of them participate in fundraising activities so that they can help one another reach their common goals and those of Fundación Paraguaya.

Sra. Eva raises chickens, cows, and pigs and later sells them to small business owners who want these animals for their meat. In addition, she sells other products such as milk from her cows, eggs from her chickens, and lard from her pigs.

loans.use: Purchase pigs, chickens, and cows

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa L. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una belleza natural, cultural y arquitectónica la misma que es admirada por propios y extraños, su gente  mantiene su cultura y tradiciones siendo muy amables y cordiales.

Doña Rosa se encuentra de 42 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 17, 15, 13 y 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar, su tercera hija estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una vulcanizadora que es de su propiedad, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Rosa realiza los quehaceres domésticos en diferentes casas, labora de lunes a viernes hasta el medio día, esta actividad la realiza hace 7 años.
 
Se encuentra en el octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para arreglar su casa ya que aun le  faltan  algunos acabados. Su meta es  viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa L. is a member of the Communal Bank “Reina de la Nube” (Queen of the Cloud). She lives in the the city of Cuenca. This city experiences cold weather, but it has natural beauty, culture, and architecture that is admired by locals and outsiders. The people are friendly, courteous, and maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña Rosa is 42 years old, married, and has four children (ages 17, 15, 13, and 10). Her two oldest children work and help with the household expenses. Her third child, a daughter, is in high school while the youngest daughter attends elementary school in the city. Her husband repairs tires and has his own shop. Rosa and her husband worked together to build their own home.

Sra. Rosa performs the housekeeping duties for various families. She has been working in this job, Monday through Friday, for seven years.

Rosa is receiving her eighth loan from the Communal Bank. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of materials for remodeling her house since it lacks a few finishes. Her goal is to travel all over the world.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Sy Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE BABACAR SY est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 17 femmes qui sont toutes du même village. Elles sont unies par affinité et par parenté. Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce, l'élevage de volailles, l'embouche ovine et bovine.

Madame MAREME D. debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée est mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses deux petits enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de poissons fumés. Elle fait également de l'embouche ovine. Cette activité elle la pratique depuis plus de 6 ans. 

Son objectif est, à partir de ses bénéfices soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la maison et du payement des frais de scolarité.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP SERIGNE BABACAR SY was created on December 30, 2009. It is composed of seventeen women who are all from the same village. They are united by affinity and kinship. Their business involves small-scale commerce, poultry farming, and the fattening of sheep and cattle.  

Ms. Mareme D. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group’s leader. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She also has two of her grandchildren in her care. Mareme has a small business selling smoked fish.  She also fattens sheep. She has been in this business for over six years.

 Using the profits, her goal is to support her husband in providing from the household and to cover the cost of schooling.

loans.use: Buying smoked fish and a sheep to fatten

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Trabajadoras se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita el 05 de mayo de 2010, gracias a que la actual presidenta del comité contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca de dicho programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando en el 1° ciclo.
La sra. Teresa es la presidenta del comité, está casada, tiene 3 hijos y posee una despensa en su casa desde hace dos años, su meta es poder equipar su despensa con todos los productos de primera necesidad para que sus clientes frecuenten su negocio, por ello solicita el crédito, para poder realizarlo.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Women Workers) is known as an excellent group of women who joined together in the city of Ita on May 5, 2010.  This group was formed as a result of the current committee president contacting a counselor at a weekly meeting that was conducted in the area.  She learned about the work that is required by the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program.  Once she was advised about the requirements of the program, she was able to gather 15 women who are starting their first loan cycle.

Sra. Teresa is married and has three children.  She has managed a food pantry out of her home for two years.  Her goal is to stock her business with all types of basic necessities for her customers who frequent her business.  She is requesting a loan so that she can accomplish this goal.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, fruits, and basic necessities used for preparing meals

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra T. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es admirada por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que le permitió ser nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su belleza natural, su gastronomía muy variada y su gente amable y cordial hacen de Cuenca una ciudad hermosa.

Doña Mayra tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos  de 14, 13 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller propio en donde  realiza de estucos (cielos rasos), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

La Señora. Mayra realiza los quehaceres domésticos de varias casas, actividad que realiza hace mucho tiempo, labora de lunes a viernes en distintos horarios. Los fines de semana tiene un pequeño negocio de comida rápida.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando: víveres, gaseosas, aguas, papas, etc. Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace dos años y medio, tiempo en el que los prestamos le ha permitido crecer poco a poco en su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
