texts.en:
Sra. Mayra T. is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun). She lives in the sector of Miraflores in the city of Cuenca. This city is admired for its architectural beauty, which contributed toward its recognition as a World Heritage Site. The natural beauty, different cuisines, and the kind friendly people are all characteristics that make Cuenca a lovely city.

Doña Mayra is 32 years old, married, and has three children (ages 14, 13, and 9). Her first two children are in high school while the youngest child attends a school in the city. Her husband works in his own shop where he makes stucco (used for installing raised ceilings). They do not own a home, so they live at the house of a relative.

Doña Mayra provides housekeeping services to different families. She has held this job for a long time and works Monday through Friday on a specified schedule. On the weekends, she manages a small business selling fast food.

The money from her loan will be invested in her business. She will buy groceries, sodas, water, potatoes, and other items. Mayra joined the Communal Bank two and a half years ago. Throughout that time, the loans have enabled her to grow her business gradually. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase groceries, sodas, water, potatoes, and other items for her fast food business

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
La Señora. Sandra L. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es admirada por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que le permitió ser nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su belleza natural, su gastronomía muy variada y su gente amable y cordial hacen de Cuenca una bella ciudad.

La Señora. Sandra tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian un una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Sandra es oriunda de Ventanas y  vive en Cuenca hace 7 años. Ella es comerciante, vende comida que elabora desde muy temprano, trabaja en dos jornadas que son de 6 a 11 de la mañana y de 3 a 6 de la tarde, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, este  nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para continuar con la venta de comida. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra L. is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun). She lives in the sector of Feria Libre in the city of Cuenca. This city is admired for its architectural beauty, which contributed toward its recognition as a World Heritage Site. The natural beauty, different cuisines, and the kind friendly people are all characteristics that make Cuenca a lovely city.

Doña Sandra is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 11, 9, and 2). Her older children attend school in the city. Sandra’s husband works as a merchant. They do not own a home, so they currently rent.

Doña Sandra is a native of Ventanas, but has lived in Cuenca for the past seven years. She is a merchant who sells food that she prepares early in the morning. Sandra works in two shifts, from 6am to 11am and from 3pm to 6pm. She has managed this business for four years.

Sandra joined the Communal Bank four years ago and the loans have benefited her business. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of groceries so that she can continue selling food. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for her food business

loans.name: Elourdes Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora. Elourdes Z. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es admirada por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que le permitió ser nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su belleza natural, su gastronomía muy variada y su gente amable y cordial hacen de Cuenca una ciudad bella.

Doña Elourdes tiene 36 años, es casada y  tiene 3 hijos de 21, 20 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.

La Señora Elourdes es comerciante de pollos actividad que la realiza hace 7 años, trabaja todos los días y cuenta con su clientela fija. También vende bisutería el tiempo que tiene libre.
 
Con el dinero de su crédito va a compra pollos y bisutería para continuar con este negocio. Es socia del banco comunal hace dos años y medio y su meta es comprarse un vehiculo para que le facilite su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Elourdes Z. is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun). She lives in the sector of Feria Libre in the city of Cuenca. This city is admired for its architectural beauty, which contributed toward its recognition as a World Heritage Site. The natural beauty, different cuisines, and the kind friendly people are all characteristics that make Cuenca a lovely city.

Doña Elourdes is 36 years old, married, and has three children (ages 21, 20, and 7). Her two older children are married and live independently. The youngest child attends school in the city. Her husband works as a merchant. They do not own a home and are currently living in a rental property.

Doña Elourdes has been selling chickens for seven years. She works every day and has an established customer base. In addition, she sells trinkets in her free time.

The money from her loan will be used to buy chickens and trinkets so that she can continue her businesses. Elourdes joined the Communal Bank two and a half years ago. Her goal is to buy a vehicle that she can use for work.

loans.use: Purchase chickens & trinkets to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre "Mujeres Emprendedoras" se conformó el 17 de mayo del 2006, mediante las promociones que realizó la Asesora en la zona, se encuentra integrado hoy día por 20 mujeres y siguen trabajando  con el mismo entusiasmo y esfuerzo. Ya se encuentran trabajando en  el 16º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo tiene un excelente comportamiento de pago, y el trato entre ellas es memorable, gracias a esto y a su trabajo solidario siguen  adelante incrementando sus ingresos y  trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
El crédito será destinado a la compra de mercaderías para la despensa y el almacén (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), especialmente la sra. Marciana, quien posee su pequeña tienda de comestibles para el sustento diario de su familia. Ella desea mucho poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar general.
Todas las miembros del grupo participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee named “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Women Entrepreneurs) was formed on May 17, 2006, as a result of promotional events conducted by the local representative. Today, twenty women have joined and continue to work with the same level of enthusiasm and effort. They are working in their sixteenth loan cycle together as part of the program.

The group has an excellent payment history and the members treat one another very well. Thanks to their work as a solidarity group, the members have been able to increase their incomes. To this day, they continue to work with the program.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise for a food pantry such as rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, tea, and other items. Sra. Marciana has a small food store that provides for the daily needs of her family. She wants to give her children a better quality of life and provide for their general well-being.

All of the group members actively participate in the weekly meetings and work together harmoniously.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, tea, and other items

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP MAME DIARRA est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes du même village. Elle exercent comme activité principale le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DIADIORDE

Madame Fatou S. (debout à droite sur la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe noire)est responsable du groupe. Elle est marié et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 02 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villes environnants pour revendre dans son village. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement. 

Son objectif est de fructifier son argent afin de soutenir son mari et ses enfants dans leurs divers besoins.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP MAME DIARRA was created on December 30, 2009. It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same village. Their main revenue-generating activity is small business. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of DIADIORDE.

Mrs. Fatou S. (standing on the right in the photo, wearing a black scarf) is the group's leader. She is married and has five children. She is also responsible for two other children that have been placed into her care by relatives. 

She buys and sells legumes. She gets her stock from the surrounding towns and sells it in her village She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Her new loan will allow her to bolster her business by increasing her stock.

Her goal is to increase her profits so she can provide for her husband and children.

loans.use: Acheter des légumes à revendre

loans.name: Juana Agripina

texts.es:
La Señora. Juana L. es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura y muchos trabajan en la ciudad. También una parte de la población ha migrado a otros países en busca de trabajo para darles a sus familias un mejor futuro.
 
Doña Juana tiene 46 años, es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos de 23, 21, 19 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda y tercera hija estudian en la universidad y su ultima hija en una escuelita de la comunidad. Vive en la casa que es de una de sus hijas.
 
La Señora. Juana es comerciante de animales, actividad que viene desempeñando hace 23 años, en su casa se dedica a la atención de sus hijos y también a cuidar sus vacas, cerdos, cuyes y pollos.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cerdos y pollos para continuar con su negocio. Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada  por su cuñada quien es socia activa del mismo. Su sueño es que sus hijos se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana L. is a member of the Communal Bank “Barrio Sucre”. She lives in the parish of Cumbe, an area that experiences cold weather. The people engage in livestock breeding and agriculture, and many of them work in the city. In addition, a subsection of the population has migrated to other countries in search of work so that they can provide their families a better future.

Doña Juana has been selling animals for 23 years. She stays at home in order to take care of her children, but she also raises cows, pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.

The money from her loan will be invested in more pigs and chickens so that she can continue her business. This is the fourth loan she has received from the Communal Bank. Juana was invited by her sister-in-law, who is an active member of this group. Her dream is to see her children succeed in life.

loans.use: Purchase pigs & chickens

loans.name: Bokk Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK DIOM est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2009 au premier financement du Banc Villageois de DIADIORDE qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont du même village. Ces femmes sont unies par des liens d'amitié, de fraternité et d'affinité. 

Madame KINE S. (debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de légumes au grand marche de son village. Elle fait aussi de l'embouche ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis environs 20 ans. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer ses activité afin d'escompter des bénéfices plus importants. 

Son objectif est des subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille
texts.en:
The BOKK DIOM solidarity group was created on December 30, 2009 at the first funding of the Banc Villageois of DIADIORDE, to which it belongs. It is composed of 15 women from the same village who are united by ties of friendship, sisterhood and affinity.

Mrs. KINE S. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the leader of the group. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of eight children.

She sells vegetables at the grand marketplace of her village. She also fattens sheep, an activity she has been practicing for about 20 years.

Her new loan will allow her to better develop her business in order to increase her profits. Her goal is to provide for her children’s needs and support her husband with the family’s financial responsibilities.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, and sheep for fattening

loans.name: Celia Guillermina

texts.es:
La Señora. Celia V. es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura y muchos trabajan en la ciudad. También una parte de la población ha migrado a otros países en busca de trabajo para darles a sus familias un mejor futuro.
 
La Señora. Celia tiene 65 años, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Celia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, también cría  animales como cuyes y gallinas que los vende en su parroquia. Trabaja en la agricultura pero lo que le produce es solo para su consumo.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar algunos acabados que le hacen falta en su casa. Su meta es crecer más en su negocio de cría de animales.
texts.en:
Señora Celia V. is a member of the Barrio Sucre Community Bank. She lives in Cumbe parish which has a cold climate. The local people raise animals and work on the land. Many go into town for work. As well, some have left to find jobs in other countries so they can provide a better future for their families.

Sra Celia is 65 years old, a widow, and has three adult children who are married and live independently. Through hard work, she has managed to build her own home. As well as taking care of her home, Celia raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens which she sells in the neighbourhood. She has some land too but only grows food for herself. 

She plans to use the loan to buy materials to complete the parts of her house that remain unfinished. Her goal is to expand her guinea pig business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Vista Alegre Group

texts.es:
El comité “Vista Alegre” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santani. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como la cría de animales para su posterior venta. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Este comité está pasando en el 2do ciclo, con muchas ganas de sobresalir adelante.
La sra. Lucila es la presidenta del comité y ella fue la que tuvo la iniciativa de formar el grupo con todas las mujeres que poseen la misma actividad, la cría de animales, porque es un rubro muy sacrificado. Solicitan el crédito para poder comprar más animales y acrecentar sus ingresos luego de que finalicen los negocios de venta de animales.
texts.en:
The Vista Alegre committee was formed by a group of several neighbours in the town of Santani. Each member has her own business: raising animals and then selling them. The group is close-knit and works together on activities that strengthen their friendship. They are now in their second loan cycle and are very eager to make progress in life.

Sra Lucila is the president of the committee and the person who founded the group, all of whom are women who raise animals for a living. It’s a difficult and time-consuming job. The women are seeking a loan to buy more animals and increase their earnings.

loans.use: to buy cows, chickens, and pigs

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es:
La señora Leoncia O. F. es de la localidad de Santani, tiene casa propia,  tiene 55 años de edad y está casada con el  señor Juan Bautista Sanabria  de 66 años de edad.
Es propietaria de una despensa y librería, con 12 años de funcionamiento, tiene buenísima ubicación en frente del Colegio Nacional de dicha localidad.
Es su cuarta operación de créditos con la Fundación Paraguaya, excelente cliente y gracias a los préstamos que recibe de la empresa su negocio está surgiendo cada día más.
Su marido también trabaja en la agricultura, tiene plantaciones de mandioca y maiz.
Ella solicita el préstamo para abastecer mejor su despensa con comestibles.
texts.en:
Señora Leoncia O. F. lives in the community of Santani. She has her own house, is 55 years old, and married to 66-year old Juan Bautista Sanabria. She owns a shop and a bookstore in a good location opposite the local Colegio Nacional.

This is Leoncia’s fourth loan with Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya. She is an excellent client, and thanks to the loans her business does better with each passing day. 

Her husband is a farmer and grows cassava and corn.

Leoncia is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Hilda Yrene

texts.es:
La Sra. Hilda es comerciante hace más de 2 años, tiene su despensa bien surtida  en el barrio San Pablo de Coronel Oviedo. Ella tiene pareja desde hace más de 6 años con el Sr. Albino, tienen tres hijos juntos, ella también comenta que la mejor manera de salir adelante es respetarse y ayudarse mutuamente en la familia, ellos se levantan a las 4 de la mañana todos los días para empezar a trabajar.
La Sra. agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza puesta en su persona y el apoyo crediticio que le está brindando y  asegura que invertirá bien su préstamo para poder devolverlo en tiempo y forma, para poder seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda has been a storekeeper for over 2 years. Her well-stocked shop is in the San Pablo neighborhood of Coronel Oviedo. She has been together for over 6 years with Mr. Albino. They have three children together. Mrs. Hilda also remarks that the best way to get ahead is to respect one another and mutually help one another within the family. The couple wakes up at 4 in the morning each day to begin work.
Mrs. Hilda thanks Fundación Paraguaya for its trust in her and for the support it offers her in loans. She assures that she will invest her loan well in order to repay it in due time and course, so that she may continue to work with the institution.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, fruits, snacks, vegetables, baked goods, legumes, etc.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta G. is from the town of Trento. She is 39 years old, married and has three children, ages 11, 9 and 5. To make a living, Marieta raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marieta works hard to build her business and earn more for her family. Marieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marieta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marieta is requesting a new loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Hedelen

texts.en:
Hedelen is 46 years old, married and supports her family by operating a business venture buying and selling charcoal. She lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her charcoal business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Hedelen is borrowing PHP 29,500 to purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Hedelen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, gasoline and buying and selling rice. Her husband Osorio, who is 69 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 35 and 48 years old. Rosa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 1,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to use as funds for her business operation so that she can continue to save up for the future, maintain good health and a successful business. Rosa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Mardie

texts.en:
Mardie is a married woman who lives in San Remegio, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a business general store and buying and selling dried fish. Her husband Remegio, who is 47 years old, works as a cane operator to earn his living.  They have six children who are 2 to 22 years old. 

Mardie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mardie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,800,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy dried fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Mardie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her business

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima is a 34-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  fishing and food vending.  She lives in the municipality of Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. Dima is borrowing PHP 10,000 to continue to fund the operations of her business. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Dima aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her business

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Long C. was born in 1974. She earns her living by selling fish in the village. In order to support and enlarge this business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more fish to sell. She will use the rest of the loan to buy chickens for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Khut Boramy, is a teacher who is able to earn a small salary to support the family. This couple has three children: two are students and also support their mother's business, and one is 3 years old. 

There are eleven members forming this village bank loan. They are from Kampong Tuol village. Mrs. Long C. is the village bank president selected by the other members.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lach's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 12 members living in Kampong Tuol village. Mrs. Lach N., born in 1962, was selected by the other members as the village bank president. The members of this village hope to increase their incomes and improve their families' standards of living through this loan.

She and her husband, Mr. Soa Sarorn, make and sell coffee and Chinese noodles. With this business, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support and expand this business, Mrs. Lach N. is requesting a loan in order to buy more Chinese noodles and coffee to offer for sale. They have a child who is enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy more Chinese noodles and coffee to offer for sale

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a 50-year-old widow who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  fishing, fish vending and providing manicure/pedicure services.  She lives in the municipality of Medellin, Cebu. Flordeliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Flordeliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,900, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy fishing gears and equipment so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Flordeliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
Twelve people have formed a village bank loan.   They are located in Roung Kou village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. P. K. was born in 1966 and is the village bank leader. She was selected to be the leader by the other members. She is a widow with five children.  Three are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is Khmer cake seller, and the last one is a student in the local school. She earns her living by selling meatballs and sugar cane. With her business, she is able to earn a small income to support her family.  Currently, her family living doesn’t have water at their home. So P. K. is asking for a loan to dig a well.

loans.use: To dig a well.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members. They are located in Chheu Khmau village in Kandal province. Mrs. Horn S. was born in 1979 and is married.  She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Lim Sok Chea, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow rice for the family's living. The farming does not bring in enough money to increase its yield. So Horn S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, gasoline, and pesticide to help grow rice.   In addition to farming, her husband earns his living by fishing. 

This couple has three children. Two are attending the local school and the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, gasoline, and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mr. Sar S. was born in 1969, and he lives in Trapeang Sva village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sum Sophat, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow rice for the family's living.  Aside from farming, Mr. Sar S. is also a construction worker, where he is able to earn a small salary to help support his family. 
In order to support the family's transportation, Mr. Sar S. would like a loan to add to his savings in order to purchase a motorcycle. 

This couple has five children.  Two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is construction worker, and the other two attend the local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To add to his savings to purchase a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan S. was born in 1976, and she lives in Tuol Krang village in Kadnal province. She is a seamstress in a garment factory where she is able to earn a small salary to support her family. Aside from her work as a seamstress, she also earns her living by selling groceries at her home. Since her business is doing well, she would like to expand it. She is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to support her business. 

Her husband, Mr. Him Vith, who is in the picture with her, was born in 1977, and is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice for a living.    He also helps in his wife's business. This couple has two children who attend the local school and also help their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to support her business.

loans.name: Nhath

texts.en:
Mr. Nhath T. was born in 1961 and lives in Stueng village in Kandal province. He earns his living by selling sugar palm and palm juice. He is also a construction worker, where he is able to earn a small salary to help support his family. With both occupations he still does not earn enough income to support and improve the family's living.  He asks for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Ieng Lin, stays at home and takes care her children and her home.
This couple has five children. Two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is construction worker, and the other two are students and also help support their father's business. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Chork

texts.en:
Mrs. Chork S. was born in 1982. She is a married woman who lives in a village called Svay Prey in the Kandal province. Chork and her husband have three children, two of whom attend the local school. Their youngest is one year old. Her husband appears in this picture with her.

Chork and her husband are pig breeders who are able to earn a small income to support their family. They also earn some income milling rice. Chork is asking for a loan to buy pig food to support her pig breeding business. She will also use part of her loan to buy spare parts to repair their rice-milling machine.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Dried fish vending is the main business activity for Mrs. Fe R..  She is 30 years of age, single and is a resident of P1 Labo, Ozamiz City. 

To find ways to support her family, Fe R. decided to engage in dried fish vending. She started this business in 2008 with a little capital. Now, she is earning an average net income of not less than P6,000.00.  With a good credit record, she is given the privilege of applying for her first loan cycle in the amount of P30,000 to use as working capital for her existing dried fish business and for her rice farm. She wishes for more progress on her business and good health to her family.

loans.use: Working capital for dried fish business and for rice farming

loans.name: Marycil

texts.en:
Marycil is 32 years old and lives in the town of Trento with her family. She is engaged in farming. She and her husband plant and harvest rice crops. They sell their harvest to the community. Aside from farming, Marycil also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells noodles, sugar and other products. Marycil said the income from the store helps in providing for their daily needs.

Marycil joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marycil has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Marycil is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita A. is from the village of Bannagao. She is 59 years old. Estrelita is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Estrelita owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Estrelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Estrelita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a married woman who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling coconuts and brooms. Her husband Harry, who is 30 years old, works as a merchandiser to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is five years old. Jonah joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jonah has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 1,500 after paying all loans and less expense, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital to continue to save up for future house repairs and business expansion. Jonah is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Elcarte's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Primitiva E., 57 years of age, is married and is a resident of Purok 3, Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Primitiva is the group leader of this three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Primitiva E.’s Group.

Primitiva is married to Lerio E., a motor cab driver. They are blessed with five adult children, two of whom are married.

To help her husband, Primitiva decided to engage in a micro-business operating a sari-sari (variety) store in addition to doing some farming activity. For a year, she has been able to maintain this business activity and is now earning an average net income of not less than P3,500 a month, which is very helpful to her family.

Primitiva joined the Cooperative in 2009.  She is an active member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) Program of Paglaum MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor.  Primitiva is requesting a loan in the amount of P10,000 for her 4th loan from PMPC. Part of this loan will be used to purchase commercial fertilizers and the remaining amount will be used for motor maintenance.
                                                                                                                                                                 
The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for Primitiva’s family, to meet their basic needs, to repay loans from PMPC, and to use for possible business expansion. 

About Group Loans:  In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farm and maintain motor for cab business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn G. is from the village of Bannagao. She is 32 years old. Marilyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. 

Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She have been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Sheikh Basti for the past 8 years. 

Farida is 48 years old and is married to A. S..  Her husband makes and sells traditional Punjabi food called Gol gappay from a cart. The food is made of flour and filled with spicy sauces, chick peas and potatoes. He operates his business by visiting different streets of the city on the cart. 

Farida supports her husband by selling spices like salt, pepper and red-chili powder. She operates her business among her community members, who buy spices from her regularly. Besides her business, she also serves her family by fulfilling their needs and taking care of their food and health.  Farida has given birth to 4 children, her eldest son has a construction supply business and the others are studying. 

Farida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients like cooking oil, spices, chick peas and potatoes in larger quantity, which will help him making Gol gappay in larger quantity and sell more to increase profit.
 
Farida is confident that her husband will be able to earn more profit by utilizing the loan in his business.  She is a new loan user of Asasah's and this is her 1st loan application. She is hopeful that it will be a good experience for her. 

Note:  In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farida.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients to make Punjabi food for sale

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: pig raising and buying and selling meat. She lives in Candoni, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Leonila is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund operations. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Leonila aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

Mrs. Marcelina M. is 38 years of age, married,  and is a resident of Remedios, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.  To make a living,  Marcelina operates a sari-sari store business and dried fish vending business. For 5 years, she was able to maintain her business, even in hard times.  She is earning an average net income of not less than P10,000, which the said is so helpful for herself and her family. 

Marcelina joined PAGLAUM MPC in 2010 because she is very much interested in our products and services.   For her 3rd cycle loan, she was given an amount of P14,999 to add to her working capital for her business. The future income from the business will be used for her family's basic daily  needs, loan repayments and savings for the future. She is hoping that someday she will be able to expand her little stall and progress her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Rany, who is 40 years old, works in maintenance on a ship to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 3 and 12 years old. Mary Ann joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Ann has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to use as additional working capital so that she could continue to save up for her children's future education. Mary Ann is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is an optimistic lady who operates a business selling paper envelopes. She does this work to support her family financially. She receives orders from different shops in the market and fulfills their orders to make an income. She lives in Okara, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its dairy industry. She has lived there with her family in a two-room brick house the area of Sheikh basti for the past twelve years.

She is 43 years old and has five children. Her elder son has a job in a college and the second son has a construction supply business. Her remaining children are enrolled in school and getting their education. Her husband’s name is T., and he works in a medical clinic for a low income. His income was not enough for the whole family; that’s why Shamim started her business of selling paper envelopes.
 
Sharim has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, because she has a large order to fill. With the loan she will purchase paper envelopes in bulk that will help her to complete the orders on time and make extra income. She is hopeful that the loan money will prove to be beneficial for the improvement of her business, and that she will be able to manage the expenses of her home better. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy paper envelopes for reselling
