Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy medicine for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old and lives with four family members. In 2003, Alaa opened his own business for selling oil and car filters. Now, he is well known and has an excellent reputation based on his experience in this field.

Alaa is requesting a $2500 loan to pay the shop’s rent expenses. He is aiming to grow bigger and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To pay the shop’s rent expenses

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Client de 43 ans , célibataire avec 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 15 ans. Il a ouvert une papeterie en 2002, quand il finit ses etudes, et ayant prit conscience de ses faibles  revenus qui ne suffisaient pas pour supporter la charge de sa famille et joindre les deux bouts du mois , avec la somme de 150.000rs il achète des cartons de rames, des cahiers et tout ce dont les écoliers ont besoin pour leurs cours.
Avec le prêt qu'on va lui accorder il pense renforcer le stock de sa marchandise, des carons de cahiers, des rames des papiers, des stylos, feutres .
Il a des revenus journaliers de de 20000 a 50000 fr par jour.Tres entreprenant , il veut aller loin dans son activité , prendre soin de sa famille, et faire des benefices énormes pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en plus épargner pour être grossiste dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Richard S. K. is a 43 year old single man with four children aged between 2 and 15 who lives in Brazzaville, Congo. He opened a paper retail store in 2002 after finishing his studies. Having realized that his current revenues are not enough to support his monthly family needs, he is asking for a loan to purchase bulk quantities of printing paper, notebooks, pens and other supplies that students need to attend school. 

He has daily revenues of between 20,000 and 50,000 francs [approximately 21 to 54 USD]. He has a very entrepreneurial spirit and would like to continue with this financial activity in order to take care of his family and provide economic benefit to improve their livelihoods and perhaps even become a wholesale distributer in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies, paper, pens, notebooks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used bags

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
La señora Silvina A. es una señora que posee un pequeño almacén en donde concurren varias personas cada día, es así que  ella decidió formar un pequeño comité de mujeres emprendedoras con sus vecinas de la cuadra, invitó a las más responsables, con muchas ganas de seguir adelante en sus trabajos diarios, son 18 señoras independientes en su trabajos, que recibirán un monto de acuerdo al ciclo en donde se encuentran.
Las mismas desean contar siempre con el apoyo crediticio de la Fundación Paraguaya, que les es de muchisima ayuda para el emprendimiento de cada una de ellas en las actividades que realizan.
La sra. Silvina solicita especialmemte para la compra de productos proveídos en su almacén.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvina A. owns a small grocery store that receives several customers every day.  She therefore decided to set up a small group of women entrepreneurs among the neighbors on her block.  She invited the most responsible ones who were willing to work hard to get ahead in their daily jobs.  There are 18 of them who have independent jobs and who will receive a proportion of the loan depending on how long they have been involved in the group.

These members depend largely on the credit support given them by the Paraguaya Foundation which has helped them greatly to establish their individual businesses.

Mrs. Silvina plans to use the loan to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit, baked goods, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes S. is a 29 year old married lady with five children. She has been operating a food Kiosk in Watamu for a period of one year, and earns a good income.

Agnes has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000, which she plans to use to purchase additional stock for her business. By doing this, Agnes hopes to grow her business rapidly; something that will enable her to earn more money. 
 

She hopes that one day she will operate her own retail shop so as to be in a good position to serve her ever growing customers well and in return get more money so as to continue helping out her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gulmamat

texts.en:
Gulmamat is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur selling groceries wholesale and retail. Gulmamat owns a grocery store in his home. He has much experience working in this sphere of trade. He launched his business over five years ago. His business is known for its reasonable pricing policy and free delivery service. Gulmamat is always on the go. He is very determined and knows how to achieve his goals. This time, Gulmamat is seeking a loan of 2,500 USD to purchase foodstuffs for his business and to expand it more. He is hoping to use the generated profit to finish remodeling his apartment, which he couldn’t complete due to some financial constraints.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.fr:
Cliente de 50 ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant. Il y a de cela 11 ans, avec un capital de 60.000frs , elle se lance dans la vente des fruits de saison comme la banane, papaye, citron, ananas, orange , avocat, barbadine et tous les fruits qu’on trouve sur le territoire congolais.
Elle s'investit pleinement dans son business, par la qualité de ses fruits, dans le choix qu’elle opère, et les prix qu’elle fixe pour la vente de ses fruits.
Avec le prêt qu’elle va recevoir, elle compte s’approvisionner, faire des stocks des fruits, ouvrir un grand étalage pour satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.
Elle pense se prendre en charge et prendre soin de sa mère et soutenir les études de son fils unique.
texts.en: Pelagie S. T. is a 50 year old single mother of one child living in Brazaville Congo. 11 years ago, with 60,000 frs [apprxlilmately 66 USD], she began to sell seasonal fruits and vegetables such as bananas, papayas, lemons, pineapples, oranges, advocados, and other fruits that are native to the Congo. She has put a lot of effort into this business which can be seen by the quality of the fruit she has available, the choice she provides, and the price she fixes for each sale. She is asking for a loan in order to stock up on fruits and provide a large display case for her customers. She will use the profits to take care of herself, her mother and her son's education.

loans.use: Purchasing seasonal fruits such as pineapples, papayas, oranges, lemons, bananas

loans.name: Salomidin

texts.en:
Salomidin has a successful business selling and repairing car accumulators (part of the air conditioning system). From his little kiosk, he sells an assortment of good quality accumulators. His business, which he has operated for about 30 years, provides the main source of income for him and his family. In the future, Salomidin hopes to expand by opening a store selling car spare parts. Salomidin has requested a loan of $2,800 to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more car accumulators. We are happy for this opportunity to provide the means for Salomidin to continue developing his business.

loans.use: To purchase more car accumulators to sell

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr:
Femme de 41 ans, mariée avec 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 11 et 27 ans.Depuis bientôt 13 ans; voyant les difficultés de sa famille et les revenus de son mari ne pouvant suffire pour prendre soin de sa famille, elle se lance dans la vente de la farine des tubercules de manioc.
Sa stratégie est d'aller acheter a la gare routière des sacs de tubercules de maniocs sèches, qu'elle écrase et se transforme en farine  dans un moulin.Cette farine de foufou est vendu au marche et cette farine est l'aliment de base , très apprécié au Congo.
Ses ventes sont de 10.000 fr a 20000frs par jour, cette activité l'aide a subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et a aider aussi a payer les frais d'écolage de son premier fils qui est universitaire.
A l'octroi de son premier prêt , elle compte renforcer son stock en achetant 10 sacs de farine et vendre au fur et a mesure que son stock s'épuise et rembourser et faire des épargnes pour atteindre ses objectifs, faire des plantations de maniocs dans son village et vendre des sacs de foufou en gros et détails .
texts.en:
Marcelline B. is a 41 year old woman, wife and mother of four children aged between 11 and 27 years old. Having seen the economic struggles of her family and given that her husband's salary was not large enough to support the entire family, she began to sell tuber and cassava root flour 13 years ago. She purchases large quantities of dried tubers and cassava root at the traveling market which she herself turns into flour with the help of a grinder. This flour, which is a staple food much appreciated in the Congo, is then sold at the market.

She earns between 10,000 and 20,000 francs a day [approximately 11 to 22 USD] which allows her to provide for her family's needs as well as help pay fees for her eldest son's university education.

She is asking for her first loan in order to purchase 10 bags of flour to sell little by little as her other stock dwindles. She would also like to begin planting cassava root areas in her village and sell bags of flour wholesale.

loans.use: Purchasing six bags of 50 kilos of cassava root flour

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en:
Komiljon is married and lives in Kabodien where he operates his own store selling household goods. He has been in this business for 15 years now. Because of his determination and customer-friendly attitude, his venture has been very successful. Komiljon currently needs a loan of $3,000 USD to increase his turnover capital. He believes that this loan will help him re-supply his inventory and encourage more customers to come and shop in his store. Increased sales, in turn, will generate the necessary funds to sustain the business as well as help him meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a second generator

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.en:
Tohirjon runs a transportation services business in his hometown of Tursunzade, Tajikistan. He is married and has one child. His transportation services are always in demand, which helps Tohirjon make good money and run his business efficiently. Tohirjon has been in this trade for six years. He seeks a loan of $2,000 USD to replace his car with a new one. He is hoping to continue running this business as it brings good income for him and for his family. Tohirjon is an experienced technician and knows a lot about vehicles. He used to sell cars in the local car market but decided to quit and launch his own small venture. Tohirjon is happy to have this business as it feeds his family and helps him to survive in this challenging economic environment.
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Yulduzkhon

texts.en:
Yulduzkhon is married with three children. She is a farmer from Tursunzade in Tajikistan. Growing up in this mostly agricultural region, she has learned many important things related to farming. She owns a greenhouse and grows different kinds of vegetables and has been in this business for 20 years. Yulduzkhon is seeking a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. She believes this loan will help her improve conditions in her greenhouses thus ensuring richer harvests and a higher income. 
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, as a key post along the Silk Road and site of the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only seven per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Ernist

texts.en:
Ernist D. is 39, married and has three children. He was born in a large family of farmers and from childhood, was the main helper in cattle breeding to his parents. He got married at the age of 20 and moved with his family to Karabalta town. In order to find means of subsistence, Ernist worked as a cleaner at the fuel station and also found underworking jobs. His wife Shakalat helped him by collecting and selling herbs. They had to rent a small jerry building at the outskirts of the town. He made every effort to provide his family with all they needed, but unfortunately, his wage didn’t cover all expenses of their household. For this reason, Ernist decided to move to Altyn village, where he started his business in cattle breeding. Starting with initial capital of 10,000 KGS, he purchased two milk cows, which allow him to earn about 1,500 KGS in a month from selling milk. Now Ernist wants to use this loan of 130,000 KGS to purchase more cows and bull calves for fattening and reselling. In the future, he dreams to develop a huge farm and build a big house for his children and grandchildren. 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 46 años y está casado con la Sra. Nelida, vive con sus hijos menores.
Sixto se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de chipas caseras (masa de almidón, considerado como panificado típico del país) en compañía de su esposa, empiezan sus actividades diarias a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para la elaboración de las chipas y su posterior venta que realiza por las compañías más cercanas de la ciudad. Tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, están cursando sus estudios primarios.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la reparación de su vehículo, pues es el medio por el que sale a recorrer para la venta de las chipas.
texts.en:
Sixto is 46 years old and married to Mrs. Nelida.  They live with their minor children.

Sixto and his wife make and sell home-made chipas (a type of starch roll which is a typical bread product in his country).  They begin their daily activity very early in the morning making their chipas which they later sell to companies located near the city.  They have four children, all minors, who are in primary school.

They plan to use the loan to repair the vehicle they use to delivery their chipas orders.

loans.use: For auto repair

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more chairs, books and other educational materials.

loans.name: Khairu

texts.en:
Khairu started her own small grocery business about 30 years ago. She operates her store from a building on property she and her husband owns. Khairu has requested a loan of $1,300 USD to make some improvements to her store. She’d like to purchase some shelving material and buy a scale to use for weighing food items. These investments will help Khairu as she continues to develop and expand her business. She hopes to use her profits to pay off her children’s college tuition. In the future, she would also like to do some remodeling to her store so that she can increase her retail space. This is Khairu’s third loan from IMON International. We are happy for another opportunity to assist her in developing a successful business. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To make improvements to her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil, bags of flour, rice, onions, tomatoes etc to sell.

loans.name: Dominique

texts.fr:
Client de 50 ans, marie et père  de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 32 a 35 ans.En 1995, il ouvre un café Restaurant ou les meilleurs clients sont les passants non loin du marche, les taxi man, et tous les potentiels clients qui viennent a tous les jours dans son restaurant.
Tres populaire, il ouvre des 6h du matin  jusqu'à 24 h, ses ventes sont de 10.000f a 50.000 par jour.
A l'octroi de son prêt , il va renforcer le stock de sa matière première en achetant des cartons de vivres frais, des palettes des œufs, un carton de lait,du fromage du sucre, nescafe, chocolat, thé.
Pour le futur, il pense faire des benefices énormes et épargner pour ouvrir un autre restaurant dans un autre quartier.
texts.en: Dominique N. is a 50 year old married man and father of two children aged 32 and 35. In 1995 he opened a restaurant not far from the market, relying on customers passing through the market, taxi drivers and others. The restaurant is very popular and is open from 6 a.m. to midnight, making between 10,000 and 50,000 francs a day [approximately 11 to 55 USD]. He is asking for a loan in order to stock up on raw materials such as cartons of fresh milk, margarine, butter, eggs, sugar, cheese, nescafe and tea. He hopes to continue making profits and be able to open another restaurant in another area of the city.

loans.use: Purchase cartons of milk, margarine, butter, eggs, sugar and cheese

loans.name: Larissa Merline

texts.fr:
Jeune cliente de 22 ans, célibataire avec un enfant age de 2 ans.Jeune fille mère , ayant prit acte de sa charge d'élever un enfant seule, avec un capital de 100.000 , elle acheta un four a bois, des moules, de la farine , des neufs et se lance dans la pâtisserie.
 Ses ventes sont de 5000fra a 20000 fr par jour, sa pâtisserie est non loin d'une école ses clients sont les élèves, les collégiens les lycéens de l'institut situe non loin de son lieu d'activite.
A l'octroi de son prêt , elle compte acheter deux sacs de farines, un sac de sucre,un sac de 50kg de lait, boite de margarine de 25 kg, un bidon d'huile de 25l et acheter un autre four a bois .
 Elle pense faire plus d'épargne et avec des benefices réalisées, elle pense agrandir a la longue sa pâtisserie et employer aussi  des jeunes filles mères.
texts.en:
This young woman is 22 years old and single with a 2-year-old child. Facing the responsibility of raising a child alone, this young unmarried mother used a capital of 100,000 frs to buy a wood stove, baking pans, flour and eggs, and started a pastry business.

Her daily sales reach 5,000 to 20,000 frs. With her pastry shop located close to a school, her clientele is composed of schoolchildren and college students from the area.

She plans to use this loan to buy two bags of flour, a bag of sugar, a 50 kg container of milk, a 25 kg container of margarine, a 25 L can of oil and another wood stove.

She expects to increase her savings, and over time, to use her profits to expand her pastry shop and hire young unmarried mothers.

loans.use: To buy two bags of flour, some sugar, some yeast, a 25 kg container of butter, a 25 L can of oil

loans.name: Karren  Atieno

texts.en:
Karren is 47 years old and married to John. They have four children, all of whom attend school. Karren owns a retail shop that she has been operating for the past ten years. She earns 18,000 KES in monthly profit. 

A friend who is a KADET client introduced Karren to KADET LTD. She is applying for her first loan to purchase shop inventory such as sugar, wheat flour, and cigarettes to sell.

Karren is a very hard-working lady. She plans to use her additional income to provide for the basic needs of her family, pay school fees, and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as cigarettes, wheat flour, and sugar

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr:
Femme de 51 ans, célibataire avec 4 enfants a sa charge dont l’âge varie entre 14 ans et 32 ans.  Vu la charge qui l'incombe, elle s’est lancée dans la vente des fruits de saison comme les oranges , ananas , papaye, mandarines, citron , et tous les fruits de la  saison  du Congo.
En 1998 , elle se lance dans la vente des fruits de saison avec un capital de 40.000 fr , et cette activité la fait vivre elle et toute sa famille.
Avec le prêt qu’elle compte recevoir, elle va renforcer le stock et acheter tous les fruits qu’elle n’arrivait pas à acheter a cause du prix, comme les fruits de la passion, les régimes de bananes plantains et bananes douces.
Vu ses bénéfices, ses ambitions qu’elle devienne grossiste, pour qu’elle-même vende des fruits tout le long de l’année.
texts.en:
Monique  L., age 51, is unmarried and has four children, aged 14 to 32, to support. In view of this responsibility, she started selling seasonal fruits such as oranges, pineapples, papayas, mandarins, lemons, and all seasonal fruits from Congo.

She started this business in 1998, with a capital of XOF 40'000. Today, it enables her to provide for herself and for her family. With the loan she's seeking now, she will bolster her stock and buy all the fruits she couldn't afford due to their cost, such as passionfruit, and bunches of sweet bananas and plantains.

In view of her profits, she ambitions to become a wholesaler, so that she can sell fruits all year long.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits (papayas, lemons, bananas, ananas, …)

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael O. is 42 years old. He is a widower from the Usenge area who has six school-aged children. Michael is a tailor and is known in his neighborhood for making nice clothes. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by a friend who has benefited from the loans. Michael wants to buy material to sell and also to make into clothes. He will use his profits to expand his business

Michael’s desire is to expand his business and open a tailoring school. He also wants to buy land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy material to sell and tailor

loans.name: Ttanda Twezimbe Star Farmers Group-Mityana

texts.en:
39-year-old Kunsa Mike K. has been in the commercial motorcycle transportation business for the past two years in Ttanda-Mityana. Before that, he was doing mostly farming. Weekly, the motorcycle business generates 60,000 shillings. On the side, Mike has an agricultural produce sales business. Friends, however, prevailed upon him to try his hand at the motorcycle business if he wanted to have a new lease of life in his circumstances. 

The happily married father of two says with this loan he is going to purchase more agricultural produce to resell. He is looking at purchasing foods such as cassava, beans, maize, rice etc to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more agricultural produce to resell.

loans.name: Simplis Eroman

texts.fr:
Client de 36 ans, célibataire sans enfant. A la fin de ses études universitaires, n’ayant pas trouve d’emploi, vu les difficultés financières rencontres, il se lance dans la vente des habits friperie et habits prêt à porter.
Sa stratégie est de vendre chez lui a domicile et au marche pour multiplier ses revenus, il fait des commandes chez les commerçants qui vont acheter a l’étranger et s’approvisionnent aussi  sur les grandes boutiques de la capitale.A l'octroi de son prêt il compte acheter des habits pour hommes, des cravates, des chemises, jeans et tous les habits a la mode qui attirent les hommes.
Ses ventes sont de 20.000 fr à 40.000 fr par jour.
Son ambition est de faire grandir son activité et faire plus de bénéfices pour qu’a la longue, il ouvre une grande boutique des habits prêts a porter pour hommes et dames.
texts.en:
Simplis Eroman K. M., age 36, is unmarried and without children. He couldn't find a job after finishing university and, because of financial difficulties, he started selling secondhand and ready-to-wear clothes.

To multiply his income, his strategy is to sell at home and at the market. He places orders with merchants who buy abroad and in the large shops in the capital. With his new loan, he intends to buy men's clothing, ties, shirts, jeans, and other fashionable clothes who attracts men. His daily sales amount to XOF 20'000 to 40'000 (ca US$ 40 to 80).

His ambition is to expand his business and increase his profits so that, in the long run, he can open a large boutique to sell ready-to-wear clothes for men and women.

loans.use: To buy jackets, shirts, ties, pullover, pullovers, trousers, jeans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing tomatoes.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 35 years old, married and with four children. He earns his daily bread through tailoring. He also sells second-hand clothes for extra income. He has managed to run his business for eleven years because he bought a sewing machine through Faulu Kenya. He hopes to grow his business so as to support his family in a better way. In the future, he hopes to become a major supplier of fabric and clothes. He needs 40,000 Kes to buy fabric and an overlock machine.

loans.use: To buy fabric and an overlock machine.

loans.name: Maria Selva

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria D. tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en el asentamiento Clarita Calle Gimenez de la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de empanadas, milanesas y bebidas en general, con clientela formada. Recuerda haber comenzado su negocio con un pequeño local vendiendo empanadas y fue creciendo con los años. Ella es una persona luchadora, se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana para iniciar su trabajo para tener listo sus ricas empanadas y comestibles en general. La Sra. comenta que antes de este negocio tenía un Cyber, el cual vendió para hacerse de capital e invertir en su negocio actual.
Solicitó apoyo crediticio a la Fundación Paraguaya  para comprar más carne para sus alimentos, de esa manera podrá aumentar sus productos y el buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria D. is 25 years old, single, without children, and lives in Clarita Calle Gimenez, a residential area in the city of Coronel Oviedo.

Mrs. Maria sells meat pies, breaded meat and beverages to an established customer base.  She remembers having established her business in a small stand selling meat pies and has been able to expand her business over the years.  She is a hard-working person who gets up at 5:00 a.m. to begin her work day and prepare her delicious pies and food in general.  Maria says she used to have a cyber-café which she sold to obtain the necessary capital to invest in her current business.

She plans to use the loan obtained through the Paraguaya Foundation to buy more meat for her products.  In this way she will be able to increase her products and improve service to customers.

loans.use: To buy meat and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To clear land for farming

loans.name: Shania

texts.en: Shania is a 24-year-old married woman living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She longs to build her own permanent residence. She has been operating a bar and restaurant for four years and the business is steadily growing,  however she is challenged by unreliable customers.  She plans to move to town. Shania needs the loan to buy a deep freezer for her business.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Nyorence Anyango

texts.en:
Nyorence Anyango W. is 30 years old. She is a widow and lives in the Manyatta area with her 16-year-old son. 

For the past four years, Nyorence has a run retail shop in Manyatta. Her monthly income is 10,000 KES. Nyorence is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to buy sugar, rice, flour, and cooking oil to add to her stock.  

In the future, Nyorence hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a married man who is blessed with a 10-year-old child who goes to school.  He makes cooking pots, plates and energy-saving cookers using scrap metal.  He has been running the business for the past 11 years and has employed two people.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business, as he was trained in business management skills.  He hopes that someday he will have a big business.  He will use the loan of 20, 000 KES to buy raw material such as scrap metal.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old and lives with six family members. In 2009, Haidar opened a food market in his area where competition is minimal. He has a good reputation and he is well known.

Haidar is requesting a $3000 loan to redecorate his shop, buy an air conditioner and install an external ceiling and a sign for his shop. He is planning to grow bigger in the future.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop, buy an air conditioner and install an external ceiling and a sign for the shop

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia P. C., es de la Ciudad de Santaní, del barrio Coronel Vicente Mongelos, es soltera, propietaria de una despensa en su propio domicilio, cuenta con clientela bien formada, con buen ingreso mensual, posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
Según ella que empezó a trabajar como macatera (vendedora ambulante de comestibles) por la zona de Guayaybi y Santaní. Y ahora ya tiene una despensa bien surtida.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la ayuda que le brinda, gracias a eso compra más mercaderías para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, su sueño es tener un local comercial más amplio para obtener más  ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia P. C. lives in the city of Santaní in the Coronel Vicente Mongelos neighborhood.  She is single and runs a grocery store out of her home.  She has a well-established customer base and a good monthly income.  She also has good business and personal references.

She began to work as a food peddlar in the areas of Guayaybi and Santaní.  And now she has a well-stocked grocery store.

She is grateful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the assistance she receives.  Thanks to the loan she is able to buy enough goods to meet customer demand.  Her dream is have a larger store so she can increase her monthly earnings.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables, bread and beverages

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael, 29, is married and has two children, ages 2 and 6.  He earns a living from tailoring and from selling secondhand clothes.  He was able to start his tailoring business after getting funds from Faulu Kenya.  He has twelve years of experience in this business.   He says that he gets a good number of customers during the festive season.   He hopes to supply uniforms to schools in five years.  He needs 20,000 KES to buy fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Renan

texts.es: El señor Renán nacido el 9 de Agosto de 1981 en Santa Cruz convive con la Sra. Rosa tienen 3 hijos que s encuentran en edad escolar, el es  agricultor tiene su tierra en San Pedro distante a 10 km de la carretera, el siembra maíz y papa pero su fuerte es la sacada de madera para vender a las carpinterías tiene su propio camión para llevar su madera y entregar a las carpinterías, le va muy bien con las dos actividades, con el dinero del crédito comprara una motosierra para facilitarle el trabajo, su esposa le ayuda en la venta de los productos que el Sr. renan siembra, ella lo comercializa en el mercado de el torno, el sr. Renan es una persona joven trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Renán was born on August 9, 1981 in Santa Cruz.  He lives with Mrs. Rosa and they have three school-aged children.  He farms land he owns in San Pedro which is 10 km from the road.  He grows corn and potatoes, but his main business is selling lumber to carpentries.  He has his own delivery truck.

Both of his activities are going well.  He plans to use the loan to buy a buzz-saw to help him in his work.  His wife helps him by selling their crops at the local market.  

Mr. Renán is a hard-working man and very grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: To buy a buzz-saw

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
Dometila is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a restaurant business for the past five years, her potential customers being travelers and neighbors. Dometila faces the major challenge of seasonality. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the 80,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a supply of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to work with Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a forty-year-old hardworking married man with four children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family, and his dream is to educate all his children to attain the minimum of a degree. 

For three years he has been into retail trade, and the business is very profitable amidst the challenge of high rental costs. His dream is to own a wholesale shop. Alex needs the loan to buy sugar, salt and soap for resale.

loans.use: Buying sugar, salt and soap for resale.

loans.name: Freih

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married and has two children. He is the only family provider. In 2007, Freih opened his own shop for photocopying services in an area where competition is minimal. He is well known and has an excellent reputation.

Freih is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a new photocopying machine and a computer. He is aiming to grow bigger and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new photocopying machine and a computer

loans.name: Graviel

texts.es: EL Sr. Graviel es nacido en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la sierra el 18 de marzo de 1950 tiene como responsabilidad llevar adelante su hogar, su conyugue es la Sra. Jesús María, el señor Graviel lleva trabajando en este rubro del servicio de camioneta de alquiler hace  10 años. Solicito el crédito en emprender lo cual se la esta brindando una el apoyo necesario para que el pueda salir adelante el crédito tiene como destino mantenimiento de su camioneta reparación de motor, es una persona trabajadora y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Graviel was born in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra, on March 18th, 1950. He is responsible for getting his family ahead. His wife is Jesús María. Graviel has been working for 10 years in the car hire business. He is requesting the loan, which gives him the necessary support so that he can get ahead. The loan will be used for the maintenance of his station wagon, specifically engine repair. He is a hard worker and is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: Maintenance of his station wagon: engine repair

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a 66-year-old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a livestock business. She lives in Calatrava, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1991 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.  Modesto is borrowing PHP 30,000 to purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 30,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Modesto aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  hog raising and a manicure/pedicure/weaving business.  She lives in Bantayan, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.  Neria is borrowing PHP 29,000 to fund the operations of her businesses. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Neria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund the operations of her businesses

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umasi is a married woman with six children, three of whom have graduated from school while three still attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a cereal stall business, selling at retail prices to her local neighbors. Umasi faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of peas, beans, rice and maize for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of peas, beans, rice and maize for sale.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food production/sales business.  She lives in the municipality of Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food production/sales business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. Nida is borrowing PHP 10,000 to fund the operations of her business. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Nida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 59 años está casado con la Sra. Esthela quien es docente y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar hace más de 20 años,  poseen tres hijos, de los cuales dos están en el colegio y una en la facultad.
Juan se dedica al ramo de taxi carga posee una camioneta Toyota Bandeirante hace más de 20 años, es uno de los pioneros de la zona, anteriormente le transportaba en su vehiculo a los pobladores de las ciudades cercanas en donde no llegaban ómnibus porque no tenían asfalto, y solamente con vehiculo particular se podía llegar a esos lugares.
Actualmente posee su propia parada y otro vehiculo trabajando en el mismo ramo en donde el chofer es su sobrino y por lo cual le remunera.
El solicita el crédito para poder reparar los neumáticos de sus dos vehículos, para mantener en buenas condiciones y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Juan is 59 years old. He is married to Esthela, who is a teacher and has been helping with the household expenses for more than 20 years. They have three children, two of whom who are in school and one who is at university. 
Juan has worked in the cargo taxi industry, he has a Toyota Bandeirante, for over 20 years. He is one of the pioneers of the area. He used to transport in this vehicle the citizens of nearby towns where the bus did not arrive due to a lack of asphalt, and only private vehicles could reach these places. 
Currently he possesses his own taxi stand and another vehicle working in the same zone. His nephew is the driver and he pays him. 
He is requesting the loan to be able to repair the tires on his two vehicles, to keep them in good condition and to continue working.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a widowed woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For over twenty years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling at retail prices, with local neighbors as her potential customers. Veronica faces the major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to shift the business to a market place where she can get a number of customers to purchase her products. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase a bundle of lesos, or Kikois, (traditional woven cotton cloth worn as a wrap, sarong, scarf or pareo) and school uniform materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of leso’s (Kikoi’s) and school uniform materials.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 43 years old, married and the father of two.  He is a hardworking businessman who makes cooking pans, pots and energy saving cookers (jiko) using scrap metals.   He has engaged in the business for ten years. He has learned business management skills and how to save his money through Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to have a fully grown business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy scrap metals.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman who lives in Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Carlito, who is 41 years old, works as a baker to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 12 to 16 years old and are currently going to school. Evelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion and education of her children. Evelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman with three children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past ten years, selling at retail prices to her neighbors. In addition, she operates a vegetable business which contributes to her other source of income.  Asha faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Ramon F. es de la Ciudad de Santaní, barrio Santa Rosa, es soltero, con casa propia, el señor es propietario de una Clínica Odontológica, es una persona muy humilde, trabajador, honesto y muy responsable; posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
Según comentó el señor, empezó a trabajar como ayudante en una clínica desde los 8 años, con un mecánico dental y de ahí en más le gustó ese trabajo y su sueño era ser un gran profesional en el ramo,  al terminar su bachillerato empezó a estudiar esa carrera, al correr de los tiempos se especializó y con gran esfuerzo y dedicación salió adelante.
Ahora ya es todo un profesional con mucha experiencia, cuenta con un local propio con toda la infraestructura necesaria para realizar dicho trabajo, con clientela bien formada. Recurre a la Institución en busca de ayuda económica para la compra de Productos Odontológicos, para poder atender en forma permanente a cada uno sus clientes brindándoles la atención adecuada que merecen.
texts.en:
Francisco Ramon F. is from Santaní City, Santa Rosa neighborhood.  He is single, with his own home. He owns a dental clinic. He is a humble, hard-working and honest person who is very responsible; he has good trade and personal references.  According to him, he started working as an assistant in a clinic when he was 8 years old with a dental technician. He liked this work and his dream was to be a great professional in the industry. After finishing high-school, he began to study this profession. Over time he specialized and with great effort and dedication got ahead.
Now he is a professional with a lot of experience.  He has his own local, with all the infrastructure necessary to perform this work and a good patient base. He turns to the institution in search of financial help in order to buy dental products to be able to permanently attend to each one of his patients, providing them the appropriate attention they deserve.

loans.use: To buy dental products

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has four children. He is the only family provider. Saad has a wealth of experience in the sales field. In 2006, he opened his own men's and women's shoe store. He is well known and has a good reputation. 

Saad is requesting a $2400 loan to redecorate his shop and increase his inventory. He is planning to grow bigger and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To redecorate the shop and increase the inventory

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: dried fish vending and fish and salt vending. Her husband George, who is 38 years old, works as a carpenter/laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 7 to 13 years old and are currently going to school.  Joy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to use as additional capital for fish vending so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Joy is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a married woman with seven children, four of whom attend school while three have already graduated. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Bendera faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
Don Germán de 35 años de edad, vive en Estelí departamento de Managua  donde nació y creció, casado con tres hijos a su cargo, de oficio comerciante y constructor, tiene alrededor de 12 años de estar en este negocio. Comenzó a trabajar a la edad de 8 años ya que su padre en el tiempo que paso la guerra se fue a la montaña a luchar y no volvió dejando solo a el y su familia por tal razón tuvo que trabajar para ayudar  a sostener a su familia y no pudo seguir estudiando solo pudo cursar hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Quien le enseño este oficio fue un albañil quien lo preparo para  aprender este oficio paso dos años como ayudante de albañil y luego 10 años como jefe de construcción de obra teniendo 2 ayudantes para apoyarlo en sus trabajos de construcción. Después inicio a trabajar con préstamo de una financiera  en 1990 para comenzar a ejecutar sus obras de construcción. Lugo  d terminar de pagar su préstamo, hizo otro préstamo para poder comprar su propio terreno, también se ha dedicado al destace de cerdo y a la siembra de granos básicos.  
El crédito lo solicita para poder seguir realizando mas trabajos de construcción, compra de materiales, herramientas necesarias para realizar sus trabajos como la construcción de una capilla en Estelí. Con este crédito  que su clientela aumente por lo menos en un 25 % mas. Dentro de sus planes futuro esta la compra de un vehículo para poder trasladar sus herramientas de trabajo y sus ayudante para disminuir el costo de transporte. Tiene como meta sacara sus tres hijos adelante, pagarles sus carreras pues es esa la mejor herencia que un padre puede dejarle a sus hijos , ya que no quieren que ellos se atrasen como le sucedió a el.
texts.en:
Germán is 35 years old and lives in Esteli, a neighborhood in Managua where he was born and raised.  He is married with 3 children under his care.  He works as a merchant and in construction where he has been working for 12 years.  His father had fought in the mountains during the war and never came back, leaving him alone with his family, which is why he began working at the age of eight; to help support his family.  He coudl not continue his studies, he only completed the 6th grade.  He learned his trade from a mason who prepared him for the job and trained with him for 2 years as his assistant.  German later spent 10 years as a construction manager with 2 workers to assist him on work sites.  
In the 1990's he had a loan financed to begin executing his own construction jobs.  After paying off his loan, he received another loan in order to purchase his own land and has also dedicated himself to butchering pigs and farming basic grains. 
He is soliciting this loan to be able to continue working his contruction jobs and purchase materials; and necessary tools to complete jobs, such as the contruction of a chapel in Esteli.  With this loan he hopes his clientele increases by at least 25%.  Within his future plans is the purchase of a vehicle to be able to transport his work tools and workers in order to diminish transportation costs.  His goal is to get his 3 children ahead; he does not want his children to get behind like he did so paying for their education is also a goal.  It's one of the best inheritances a father could leave his kids.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials and tools to complete jobs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a thirty-one-year-old married man with four children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family, and his desire is to give his children a good education. 

He has three motorcycles, and for the last three years he has been able to establish himself in the motorcycle transport business.  His desire is to own at least five motorcycles, as the business is very lucrative. David needs the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Qoya, provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Teofilo; El socio tiene 54 años de edad, el socio  es casado; el socio tiene 1 hijo; el socio trabaja prestando servicio de taxi, el socio tiene un vehículo y lo desea vender para comprar otro automóvil más y hacerlo trabajar en la prestación de servicios de taxis en la ruta Cusco Calca. El socio desea el crédito para invertir en algunos pequeños arreglos de su vehículo para poder venderlo y con la venta que genere este y un ahorro que tiene comprar un nuevo auto del año.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “CAPAC QOYA” community bank. This bank is located in the district of Qoya, province of Calca, departament of Cuzco.

The member is Teofilo. He is 54 years old and married. He has 1 son. He works as a taxi driver. He has a vehicle and wants to sell it to buy another car and have it work as a taxi on the Cuzco Calca route. He wants the loan to invest in some small repairs on his vehicle to be able to sell it and with the sale's proceeds and some savings, buy a new car, this year's model.  

The member is happy with the loan that has been given him and is committed to making his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To invest in fixing up his vehicle and selling it.

loans.name: Dourng

texts.en:
Dourng C. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. sells groceries, earning an income of about $14 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Her husband rents speakers for any ceremony, earning an income of about $7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $55 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more speakers to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her 2nd loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy speakers to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a pig fattening business. She lives in Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.  

Soledad is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can purchase more pig stocks and feeds.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Soledad aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feeds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills. 

She has operated an M-pesa (a mobile-phone-based money-transfer) service for the past five years, operating in a shop whereby neighbours and passersby are her potential customers. Juliet hopes to establish another business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase a money float and credit cards for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a money float and credit cards for sale.

loans.name: Ourng

texts.en:
Ourng H. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

H. repairs motorbikes, earning an income of US $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $50 on food and US $20 on the other necessary expenses. 

H. is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene realiza trabajos en costura  como ser chamarras y overoles de trabajo; el crédito lo necesita para el aumento de mercadería y materia prima para continuar con su negocio. La esposa de Rene trabaja en el interior del país, y él es el que cría a sus tres hijos. Vive  en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y con KIVA.
texts.en: Rene is a tailor, making clothing such as jackets and overalls. He needs the loan to increase his merchandise and raw materials to continue his business. Rene’s wife works in the interior of the country, and he is the one who takes care of their three children.  He lives in his own house located in the zone of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. He has three children. This is the first time that he works with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, such as fabrics, linings, buttons and zippers for his business making jackets and overalls.

loans.name: Chory

texts.en:
Chory K. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products.

K. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of US $1.30 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $50 on food and US $5 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a house for the children to live in. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. 

K.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a house for the children to live in

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian lives in the municipality of Medellin, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  fishing and fish vending.  Her common-law husband  Necanoro, who is 41 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living.  She has seven children who are 9 months to 14 years old.  Vivian joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vivian has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Vivian is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Juan Marcos

texts.es: Don Juan se dedica a la elaboración de cereales desde hace seis años, anteriormente trabajo en una fabrica donde elaboraban dichos productos, aprendio el proceso de elaboración y se independizo y comenzó con negocio propio desde hace tres años realizando sus ventas en ferias locales, actualmente vive en la localidad de el paso, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor ya que los precios van subiendo rápidamente y prefiere tener almacenado para evitar el alza de precios de sus insumos para la elaboración de cereales, es una persona joven trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.  OJO en la foto aparece junto a la promotora de ventas.
texts.en:
Don Juan has earned his living making cereals for 6 years.  Earlier he worked in a cereal factory and learned the process.  Three years ago, he went out on his own and started his own business, selling his product at local fairs.  Now his lives in Paso with his wife and their three school-aged children.  

Don Juan is seeking a loan to buy ingredients wholesale.  Prices are going up up rapidly and he would rather store the goods to avoid the price hikes.  He is a young, hard-working person and is very grateful to the Institutión for its support. He appears in the photo along with his sales promoter.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cereals.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 53 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 14 et 33 ans. En 2010 ayant vu les différentes charges de sa famille, son mari qui avait prit sa retraite, les frais d’écolage des enfants a l’université, elle ouvre un dépôt de boissons gazeuses et non gazeuses.
Pour ce faire, avec un fond de commerce que son mari lui avait attribué, elle s’achète des casiers des boissons vides et elle trouve un abonnement a la brasserie pour ouvrir un grand dépôt de boissons, c’est une activité très rentable, ses ventes sont de 50.000 a 150.000 fr par jour. Avec le prêt elle compte renforcer son capital et acheter des vins, des boissons importées et tous ce dont les clients ont besoin.
Elle pense a l’avenir q’ avec les bénéfices qu’elle a du jour au jour  être un distributeur des boissons en gros .
texts.en: This customer is a 53-year old businesswoman, who is married and mother to six children, whose ages range from 14 to 33 years old. Being aware of the various family expenses, the fact that her husband has retired and her children's university education costs, she opened a store for fizzy and non-fizzy drinks in 2010. In order to do this, she bought with the funds that her husband gave to her, empty crates of drinks, and she managed to get a contract from the brasserie to open a large drinks store. It is a very lucrative activity and she has sales of 50,000 to 150,000 drinks a day. With the loan she is planning to increase her capital and buy wines, imported drinks and everything that her customers need. With the day-to-day profits she makes she is planning in the future to become a wholesale distributor of drinks.

loans.use: Purchase of crates of beer, fizzy drinks, imported drinks, wines

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a married woman who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Joel, who is 48 years old, works as a mechanic to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 17 to 27 years old.  Jesusa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jesusa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to purchase more stock so that she can save up for the future and the education of her daughter.  Jesusa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, sacks of sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N., 42, resides with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Sok and her husband sell duck eggs, earning an income of USD 5 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 75 on other necessary expenses.

Sok is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more duck eggs to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase more duck eggs to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario es jubilado y su esposa tiene un puesto de venta en el cual comercializa una variedad de abarrotes (arroz, fideo, aji, etc.); con el dinero del crédito podrá cubrir los gastos de medicamentos para su esposa, que se encuentra delicada de salud.

Mario y su esposa viven en casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en al zona de Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Mario is retired, and his wife has a sales stand where she sells a variety of groceries (rice, noodles, and red peppers, etc.)

With the money from the loan he will be able to cover his wife’s medication expenses as she is in delicate health.

Mario and his wife live in their own house, which is in the Cotahuma zone of the city of La Paz.

loans.use: To buy medications for his wife who is in delicate health

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro José tiene 54 años, su actividad es ofrecer medicina ambulante. Desde hace 21 años que tiene este medio de vida, esta no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con créditos, por lo que se siente muy satisfecho con los que ha realizado. Este negocio lo aprendió por su compañera de vida quien le enseña lo necesario para continuar trabajando. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y así comprar una gran variedad de medicamentos. Sueña con de ofrecer diferente productos.
texts.en:
Pedro José, age 54, sells medicine in an itinerant manner.  He has had this way of life for 21 years.  This is not the first experience he has had with loans.  He is very satisfied with the ones he has received.

He learned this business from his life partner.  She taught him what he needed in order to continue working.

The loan is for working capital.  He will buy a large variety of medicines. 

He dreams of selling different products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nambou

texts.fr:
L. est une cliente de HOPE Congo. Elle a 37 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre  5 et 16 ans. 
Ayant constaté que le salaire de son mari ne suffisait pas pour supporter la charge de sa famille et les enfants prendre en charge les frais d’écolage des enfants, elle décide  de monter une activité en 2007,  avec la somme de 40.000 frs, elle ouvre un restaurant spécialité grillade de viande de bœuf, cuisse de poulet et de poissons.
Avec le prêt octroyé, elle compte acheter des  2 cartons de steak de viande de bœuf, 3 cartons de cuisse de poulets, et un carton de poissons, un bidon d’huile de 25l, des épices et du maniocs.
Ses ventes sont considérables, elle a des revenus journaliers de 30.000frs à 70.000 frs par jour, elle a aussi des gros bénéfices et elle est entrain d’épargner pour agrandir et ouvrir un grand restaurant.
texts.en:
L. is a client of HOPE Congo. She is 37 years old, married and mother of 4 children aged between 5 and 16 years.

Seeing that the wages of her husband were not enough to support the expenses of her family and children, as well as the expenses of their schooling, she decided to begin an activity in 2007. With the sum of 40,000 frs, she opened a restaurant with a specialty of grilled beef, chicken leg and fish. 

With the new loan, she intends to buy of the 2 cartons of beef steak, 3 cartons of chicken leg, and a carton of fish, an oil can of 25 liters, spices and maniocs. 

Her sales are considerable, with daily incomes of 30.000frs to70.000 frs, she has also a good return and she is in the process of saving to grow and open a large restaurant.

loans.use:
Purchase  cartons of :
sides of pork , sausage, chicken legs, chicken wings

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou R., 57, resides with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Ou is a farmer who raises pigs, earning an income of USD 3 per day, while her husband, a construction worker, earns an income of USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 85 on other necessary expenses.

Ou is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to operate a coffee shop, and in the future she would like to use the resulting additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To operate a coffee shop

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de capitalizar su actividad y emprender actividades productivas, les resultó muy fructífero e interesante el programa por los beneficios brindados.
El comité lleva por nombre Tajy Poty, actualmente se encuentra en el quinto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 19 emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarles lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
La sra. Elva V. por ejemplo, es una vendedora de frutas y verduras, y ahora, como se inicia la temporada de otoño en nuestro país, necesita de mayores frutas cítricas para vender, por ello solicita el préstamo para poder abastecer su pequeño puesto de venta, y obtener más ganancias que favorezcan el ingreso económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Some women get together in the city of Paraguarí in order to capitalize their business activities.  Others do so in order to undertake productive activities.  From there they coordinate the meeting in order to familiarize themselves with the program.  This has turned out to be very fruitful and interesting because of the benefits that are offered by the program.

The Communal Bank is called Tajy Poty.  They are currently in their fifth cycle with an excellent rating.  The members are 19 enterprising women.
