They give the best of themselves in order to increase their incomes.  They do this so that they can offer their respective families the best.  All of the members are tenacious, and they have invested their loans in their respective business activities.

Elva, for example, sells fruits and vegetables.  Now that the fall season is starting in our country, she needs more citrus fruits.  That is why she requests the loan in order to be able to stock her small sales stand.  She will get more earnings that will help her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits like citrus fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Association Bakijjulula-Mityana Group

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Recheal K. is a chapatti seller in Mityana Town. Although a highly competitive business, during her six months of operation she has been able to make significant ends meet out of it. Recheal ekes out some additional profits from her tea sales trade. This business earns her 100,000 shillings weekly as profit.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more cooking oil to fry more of the chapattis that she sells to old and new clients alike. Recheal is affiliated with Tukolerewamu Association Bakijjulula Group.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil

loans.name: Merylou

texts.en:
Merylou is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fruits & vegetables business.  Her husband Petronito, who is 45 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  They have two children who are 12 and 23 years old.  Merylou joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merylou has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,600, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy additional bananas for resale so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business.  Merylou is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for resale

loans.name: Baudelaire

texts.fr:
Jeune client de 27 ans, célibataire de son état sans enfant, a l’obtention de son Bac, ses parents n’ayant pas pu le soutenir pour des études universitaires, en 2007, il ouvre une cabine téléphonique et fait la vente des cartes prépayées de tous les réseaux téléphoniques.
Ses ventes sont de 50000 frs à 150000frs par jour.

A l’octroi de son prêt, il veut faire la distribution des cartes téléphoniques comme Zain, MTN, Airtel. Et ajouter deux nouveaux téléphones, et faire un abonnement Sotelco et Congo Telecom.
 Tres ambitieux, il veut a la longue avec ses bénéfices ouvrir une boutique de ventes des appareils cellulaires et être fournisseurs des cartes prépayés et refill
texts.en:
Young 27 year old client, single without children, on working for his Baccalauriat degree, his parents not having been able to support him for academic works, in 2007, he opened a phone box and sells prepaid cards of all the phone networks.

His sales are between 50000 frs to150000frs per day. 

With the loan, he wants to distribute telephone cards like Zain, MTN, Airtel. 

And to add two new telephones, and to make a subscription to Sotelco and Congo Telecom. 

Very ambitious, he wants with the loan to open a shop for sales of cellular devices and to supply prepaid and refillable cards.

loans.use: Buy telephones, recharge cards for MTN Warid, Airtel, And telcom subscription

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El  señor Francisco es sastre y tiene un taller de sastrería; el crédito lo requiere para comprar la prótesis que necesita su esposa, ella realiza papas fritas y las comercializa. Ambas actividades son su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Vive en la casa de su suegra ubicada en la zona de Obispo Bosque en la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: Franciso is a tailor and he has a talior's shop. He needs the loan to buy a prosthetic that his wife needs. She prepares and sells french fries. These two activities are the main source of income that supports them. He lives in his mother-in-law's house in the Obispo Bosque area of La Paz.

loans.use: To buy a prosthetic for his wife.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, es una mujer de 35 años que vive junto a su esposo Carlos. Los dos cuidan de sus 4 hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). La venta de ropa, es su principal actividad económica, desde entonces Lourdes visita a sus clientes durante las mañanas, ellos gustosos compran las novedades que trae. El secreto para su buena venta, son las facilidades de pagó que brinda, ya que deja a crédito las prendas que vende. En sus 8 años de experiencia nunca tuvo dificultades, ahora se dedica a la venta de cerveza al por mayor, aprovechando los conciertos artísticos locales, logrando percibir un dinero extra. Pero su mayor prioridad es acondicionar un espacio en su casa, para poder abrir una tienda de venta de ropa para toda ocasión. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Optimistas”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera obtener muchos éxitos. Lourdes, constantemente compra mercadería, por ello con el crédito adquirirá 700 a 800 prendas de vestir entre, pantalones, polos, ropas interiores y uniformes escolares para la campaña escolar que se avecina.
texts.en:
Lourdes, age 35, lives with her husband, Carlos.  Both of them take care of their four children in their own house in the city of La Merced (central Peruvian jungle).  Selling clothes is her primary business activity.    Lourdes visits her customers during the mornings.  They gladly buy the latest fashions that she brings.

The secret to her good sales is the easy payment that she offers.  She leaves the clothes that she sells on credit.  In her eight years of experience she has never had difficulties.

She now sells wholesale beer, taking advantage of the local artistic concerts.  She manages to get extra money that way.  But, her greatest priority is to equip a space in her house in order to be able to open a store selling clothing for all occasions.  

She belongs to the “Las Optimistas” (The Optimists) Communal Bank.  This is their first loan with MFP, and they hope to obtain many successes.  Lourdes constantly buys merchandise.  Therefore, she will use the loan to get 700 to 800 garments like pants, polo type shirts, underwear, and school uniforms for the coming school season.

loans.use: To buy clothing like school uniforms

loans.name: Cham

texts.en: Cham C., 28, resides with her family in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. C. is a cleaner, earning an income of USD 2.6 per day. Her mother sells snacks, earning an income of USD 2.6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 5 on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more snacks and groceries to stock her mother’s store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more snacks and groceries to resell

loans.name: Joesela

texts.en:
Joesela is a married woman who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  pig fattening and buying & selling dried fish. Her husband Deonilo, who is 42 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 8 to 20 years old.  Joesela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joesela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 23rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to purchase additional piglets so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Joesela is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets

loans.name: Rorm

texts.en:
Rorm S. resides with his family in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. S. is a stereo and TV repairman, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Qoya, provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Evangelina; La socia tiene 48 años de edad, la socia  es viuda; la socia tiene 2 hijos 22 y 15 años; la socia trabaja  administrando sus tierras de cultivo y sus animales menores, ella cría cuyes, pollos, gallinas, chanchos y también cultiva sus terrenos de maíz y alfa alfa (alimento para animales menores y ganados en general); La socia vende al por mayor lo que producen sus tierras y esta es la época para retirar el maíz y poner alfa alfa al sembrar este producto ella tendrá mas facilidad de que lo recoja en dos meses y así volver a sembrar el maíz para la nueva temporada. la socia trabaja también sembrando verduras que en cuestión de meses podría cosechar. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la cosecha, después ella preparara el terreno para sembrar una nueva etapa de maíz y alfa lafa, y necesita comprar abono para pasar en sus terrenos una vez que este sembrado los terrenos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Capac Qoya", which is located in the Qoya district of the Calca province in the department of Cusco.
The member's name is Evangelina, she is 48 years old and widowed. She has 2 children of 22 and 15 years of age. She works tending her farmland and raising small animals. She raises guinea pigs, chickens, hens, and pigs and also grows corn and alfalfa (food for small animals and other livestock). She sells her produce wholesale, and this is the season for removing the corn and planting alfalfa. It is easiest if she harvests this product in two months and then returns to sowing corn in the new season. The member also works growing greens, which she can harvest in a matter of months. She needs the loan to invest in her harvest, then she will prepare the land to sow a new crop of corn and alfalfa. She also needs to buy fertilizer to spread on the fields once they are planted. 
The member is happy with the loan offered to her and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy crops and small animals.

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es:
Leydi tiene una tienda donde comercializa variedad de verduras; la tienda esta ubicada en la zona de Achachicala en la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo necesita para adquirir más verduras y frutas para aumentar la cantidad de clientes.
Vive  en casa  de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Alto Lima de la ciudad  de El Alto. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y con KIVA. Leydi es soltera.
texts.en:
Leydi has a store where she sells a variety of vegetables. The store is located in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz. She needs the loan to acquire more fruits and vegetables and increase the quantity of her customers.
She lives with her parents in a house in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto. This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO or Kiva. Leydi is single.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in greater quantity to satisfy the demands of her customers.
